**Trade union representatives** 




 Contact information to trade union representatives can be found at
 
 KTH's web page
 
 .
 



  





**Application** 




 Your application should follow
 
 KTH's CV template for employment of teachers
 
 . It is the responsibility of the applicant to ensure that the application is complete according to the requirements in the ad and CV template.
 



  





 Your complete application must be received at KTH no later than the last day of application, midnight CET/CEST (Central European Time/Central European Summer Time).
 



  





 Log into KTH recruitment system in order to apply to this position.
 



  





**Other** 




 Time limitation:The appointment is for an indefinite term, but no more than six years, and may be extended if, due to the teacher’s absence due to sick leave, parental leave or other special grounds, more time is required to reach the objectives of the appointment. However, the total appointment period may not exceed eight years. The appointment is part of the Tenure Track system at KTH and the assistant professor may apply for promotion to tenured associate professor.
 



  





 For more information regarding KTH's assessment, see
 
 Appointments procedure at KTH
 




 Striving towards gender equality, diversity and equal conditions is both a question of quality for KTH and a given part of our values.
 



  





 For information about processing of personal data in the recruitment process
 
 please read here.
 




  





 It may be the case that a position at KTH is classified as a security-sensitive role in accordance with the Protective Security Act (2018:585). If this applies to the specific position, a security clearance will be conducted for the applicant in accordance with the same law with the applicant's consent. In such cases, a prerequisite for employment is that the applicant is approved following the security clearance.
 



  





 Guidance on
 
 relocating and settling
 
 in at KTH and in Sweden.
 



  





 We firmly decline all contact with staffing and recruitment agencies and job ad salespersons.
 



  





 Disclaimer: In case of discrepancy between the Swedish original and the English translation of the job announcement, the Swedish version takes precedence.
 



  





**About KTH** 




 KTH Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm has grown to become one of Europe’s leading technical and engineering universities, as well as a key centre of intellectual talent and innovation. We are Sweden’s largest technical research and learning institution and home to students, researchers and faculty from around the world. Our research and education covers a wide area including natural sciences and all branches of engineering, as well as architecture, industrial management, urban planning, history and philosophy. Read more here

title: Underwriter CAR/Energy
description:
Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

 AXA XL is looking for an underwriter to take a role for writing Energy risk and Construction.
   

  

 Our underwriting teams set us apart, our experienced underwriting professionals use their specialized expertise to underwrite even the most complex risks innovatively. A rare and exciting position is now available in our Property team for an underwriter to support and grow the Construction and Energy insurance product in the Nordic region. At the crux of this role is the ability to underwrite Energy/Construction risks and support brokers/clients in understanding our product and finding tailor-made solutions for the individual client. All with a chance to develop within the insurance industry in a supportive team led by experienced industry professionals.
   

  

**What You’ll Be DOING**
 What will your essential responsibilities include?
   

  

* Underwriting, managing and growing the Nordic Energy/Construction insurance portfolio
* Developing the offering to this segment and executing on AXA XL Property International’s expansion plans for the region
* Proactively advising, servicing and following up with clients on insurance and risk management matters, and actively identifying opportunities for cross-selling AXA XL’s products
* Assisting in the introduction of new products where opportunities arise


 You will be based in the AXA XL Stockholm office and will report to the Property Underwriting Manager for the Nordics. The position requires travelling, both domestically and abroad.
   

  

**What You Will BRING**
 We’re looking for someone who has these abilities and skills:
   

  

**Required Skills And Abilities**
* Relevant experience in property underwriting, ideally in a Nordic country. Other experience from Energy or Construction underwriting would be an advantage
* A team player, ready to share your experience
* Driven and good negotiator
* Languages: Swedish and English. Any other Nordic language orientation is an advantage


**Desired Skills And Abilities**
* Solution oriented approach - ability to respond to a changing environment with flexibility and innovation
* Analytical and logical thinker


**Who WE Are**
 AXA XL, the P&C and specialty risk division of AXA, is known for solving complex risks. For mid-sized companies, multinationals and even some inspirational individuals we don’t just provide re/insurance, we reinvent it.
   

  

 How? By combining a comprehensive and efficient capital platform, data-driven insights, leading technology, and the best talent in an agile and inclusive workspace, empowered to deliver top client service across all our lines of business − property, casualty, professional, financial lines and specialty.
   

  

 With an innovative and flexible approach to risk solutions, we partner with those who move the world forward.
   

  

 Learn more at axaxl.com
   

  

**What We OFFER**
**Inclusion**
 AXA XL is committed to equal employment opportunity and will consider applicants regardless of gender, sexual orientation, age, ethnicity and origins, marital status, religion, disability, or any other protected characteristic. At AXA XL, we know that an inclusive culture and enables business growth and is critical to our success. That’s why we have made a strategic commitment to attract, develop, advance and retain the most inclusive workforce possible, and create a culture where everyone can bring their full selves to work and reach their highest potential. It’s about helping one another — and our business — to move forward and succeed.
   

  

* Five Business Resource Groups focused on gender, LGBTQ+, ethnicity and origins, disability and inclusion with 20 Chapters around the globe.
* Robust support for Flexible Working Arrangements
* Enhanced family-friendly leave benefits
* Named to the Diversity Best Practices Index
* Signatory to the UK Women in Finance Charter


 Learn more at axaxl.com/about-us/inclusion-and-diversity. AXA XL is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
   

  

**Total Rewards**
 AXA XL’s Reward program is designed to take care of what matters most to you, covering the full picture of your health, wellbeing, lifestyle and financial security. It provides competitive compensation and personalized, inclusive benefits that evolve as you do.
   

  

 We’re committed to rewarding your contribution for the long term, so you can be your best self today and look forward to the future with confidence.
   

  

**Sustainability**
 At AXA XL, Sustainability is integral to our business strategy. In an ever-changing world, AXA XL protects what matters most for our clients and communities. We know that sustainability is at the root of a more resilient future. Our 2023-26 Sustainability strategy, called “Roots of resilience”, focuses on protecting natural ecosystems, addressing climate change, and embedding sustainable practices across our operations.
   

  

**Our Pillars**
* Valuing nature: How we impact nature affects how nature impacts us. Resilient ecosystems - the foundation of a sustainable planet and society - are essential to our future. We’re committed to protecting and restoring nature - from mangrove forests to the bees in our backyard - by increasing biodiversity awareness and inspiring clients and colleagues to put nature at the heart of their plans.
* Addressing climate change: The effects of a changing climate are far-reaching and significant. Unpredictable weather, increasing temperatures, and rising sea levels cause both social inequalities and environmental disruption. We're building a net zero strategy, developing insurance products and services, and mobilizing to advance thought leadership and investment in societal-led solutions.
* Integrating ESG: All companies have a role to play in building a more resilient future. Incorporating ESG considerations into our internal processes and practices builds resilience from the roots of our business. We’re training our colleagues, engaging our external partners, and evolving our sustainability governance and reporting.
* AXA Hearts in Action: We have established volunteering and charitable giving programs to help colleagues support causes that matter most to them, known as AXA XL’s “Hearts in Action” programs. These include our Matching Gifts program, Volunteering Leave, and our annual volunteering day - the Global Day of Giving.


 For more information, please see axaxl.com/sustainability.

title: Lösningsarkitekt inom mjukvaruutveckling - Castra
description:
*Vill du ta ditt konsultande till nästa nivå hos en av Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare? Vi vet vad du tänker. Du har hört det förut. Men tro oss, det har du inte. Vårt körsbär på konsulttårtan är något annat. Sök jobbet och smaka själv!*
**Rollen**
 Som Lösningsarkitekt inom mjukvaruutveckling kommer du att inneha en central roll i att definiera och skapa övergripande tekniska lösningar för komplexa mjukvaruprojekt hos våra kunder. Du kommer att arbeta nära företagets ledning och teknikteam för att utforma arkitekturen och säkerställa att mjukvarusystemen uppfyller företagets strategiska mål och tekniska krav. Du kommeratt säkerställa att tekniska lösningar stödjer företagets mål och att systemarkitekturen är stabil, skalbar och säker.
   

  

**Erfarenhet**
 Du har en stark bakgrund inom mjukvaruutveckling samt arkitekturarbete i agila utvecklingsprocesser och har fördelaktigt moderniserat mjukvarulösningar förr.
   

  

 Vi ser även att du har:
   

  

* Bakgrund inom utvecklin med erfarenhet av exempelvis Java, C#/.Net, Python samt diverse ramverk
* Förmåga att förstå och översätta företagets strategiska mål till tekniska krav och lösningar.
* Design av systemarkitekturer med hänsyn till skalbarhet, prestanda och säkerhet
* Skapande av tekniska specifikationer och arkitekturdokumentation.
* Erfarenhet av molnbaserad arkitektur och tjänster som AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud.
* Kunskap containerteknik som Docker och Kubernetes


 Därtill är det av stor vikt att du besitter goda kommunikationsfärdigeter då arbetet ske i nära samverkan med såväl teknikteam som intressenter. Vi ser även att du är genuint intresserad av att upprätthållande kunskap om den senaste teknikutvecklingen inom mjukvaruutveckling och arkitektur.
   

  

 Låter detta som du? Hör av dig så tar vi ett möte i veckan!
   

  

**Det bästa åt de bästa – vår personalfilosofi**
 Castra är en konsultgrupp inom IT och management. Eller ja, en elite squad kan man säga. Vi samlar de vassaste och mest erfarna konsulterna, helt enkelt för att det är hos oss de får ut max i både kapacitet och livskvalitet.
   

  

 Vi är en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser. Det låter lite skrytsamt, förlåt. Men det är faktiskt inte vi som sagt det. Castra har sedan 2017 blivit certifierad av Great Place to Work och har de senaste tre åren blivit utnämnda till en av Sveriges Bästa Arbetsplatser. Som grädde på moset är vi även Gasell- och Karriärföretag.
   

  

 På Castra tror vi på frihet, utveckling och gemenskap. Du som konsult styr själv vilka uppdrag du tar, när du jobbar, om du vill levla upp någon kompetens och hur och mycket lön och semester du tar ut. Att du får bygga din egen logga är bara ytterligare ett bevis. Trodde du det var allt? Då trodde du fel. Stöd av bra chefer, aktiviteter, kompetent och snabbfotad säljstyrka, möjlighet till delägarskap, stora möjligheter att påverka bolagets framtid och härliga kollegor – listan på vad som gör Castra till en fantastisk arbetsplats kan göras lååång. Summan av kardemumman är att hos oss är möjligheterna bra nära oändliga. Win för alla parter, säger vi.
   

  

*Castra har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Eskilstuna, Malmö, Linköping, Norrköping, Örebro och Jönköping.*
 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss på castra.se/konsulterbjudande/
   

  

**Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?**
 Sök via länken eller hör av dig till Charlotta.Ljung@Castra.se

title: Solution Manager Security
description:
**Om Bankgirot** 




 En omvälvande transformation av betalsverige – där du behövs!
 



 Bankgirot söker nu en Solution Manager Security till en växande del av organisationen i Stockholm. Bankgirot har en unik ställning på Sveriges betalmarknad som nu genomgår den största transformationen i modern tid. Vår IT-organisation är i en tillväxtfas för att utveckla framtidssäkrade lösningar som följer internationell standard och regelverk. Samtidigt ser vi till att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar säkert och stabilt – varje dag.
 



  





 Arbetet med att utveckla framtidens betalinfrastruktur är i full gång och vi behöver dig som vill vara en del av resan. Som Solution Manager kommer du att spela en viktig roll i uppdraget att säkerställa framtidens betalinfrastruktur på ett teknikbolag där vi har ett stort hjärta för uppdraget – och varandra.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 I rollen som Solution Manager Security på Bankgirot kommer du ansvara för att kravställa att IT-tjänster är i linje med Bankgirots målarkitektur och riktlinjer avseende tekniska och säkerhetsmässiga krav. Du kommer samarbeta med både interna och externa intressenter och är en del av deras SIAM-organisation (Service Integration and Management).
 



 Du kommer spela en viktig roll för att etablera de mest robusta och säkra lösningarna i uppbygganden av en ny och modern driftsmiljö. Bankgirot har en unik ställning och är en nyckelaktör i Sveriges betalinfrastruktur gällande clearing och settlement.
 



  





**I rollen kommer du att:** 



* Säkerställa att lösningar inom ditt tjänsteområde uppfyller de tekniska och säkerhetsmässiga kraven.
* Delta i samarbete med både interna och externa intressenter för att förvalta tjänsteleveransen.
* Ansvara för versioner och konfigurationer, och stödja Service Manager i att säkerställa att tjänsters livscykelhantering följer säkerhetskraven.
* Arbeta nära processorganisationen och tillämpa ITIL-ramverket för att uppfylla krav på lösningar.
* Stödja Service Manager och Vendor Manager i arbetet med SLA, OLA och KPI samt kravställa övervakning och kapacitetsrapportering.
* Bidra med expertis vid tekniska riskanalyser och proaktivt identifiera utvecklingsområden.



  





**Om dig** 




 Vi söker dig som har ett stort självledarskap och som tar ägarskap för dina frågor. Du är en god kommunikatör med förmåga att möta olika intressenter på olika nivåer, både internt och externt.
 



 Du är lyhörd, duktig på att bygga relationer och skapa förtroende. Du är inkännande och har ett strategiskt förhållningssätt. Vidare är du positiv, drivande och kan prioritera och planera ditt arbete väl.
 



  





**Du har:** 



* Förmåga att förvalta och utveckla ett komplext IT-säkerhetsarbete.
* Erfarenhet av att genomföra riskbedömningar och utveckla riskhanteringsstrategier.
* Erfarenhet av IT-leveranser baserade på ITIL.
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att tillämpa styrande regelverk för finansiella aktörer.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av att hantera och underhålla IT-infrastruktur, nätverk och kommunikationsprotokoll.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
* Relevant utbildning.



  





**Ett utvecklande arbete med bra förmåner** 




 Som vår nya kollega blir du en del av ett kompetent och positivt team där vi samarbetar och sätter högt värde på varandras kompetens och erfarenheter. Du är med och driver spännande satsningar där vi stärker vår operativa förmåga ytterligare och använder den senaste tekniken.
 



 På Bankgirot känner du dig snabbt välkommen in i gemenskapen. Här hjälps vi gärna åt, ger varandra beröm och tar hand om varandra. Om vi mår bra och har balans i livet kan vi också leverera med kvalitet. Därför satsar Bankgirot mycket på hälsa och välmående och erbjuder generösa förmåner för dig som medarbetare.
 



  





**Övrig information** 




 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning baserad i Liljeholmen i Stockholm. Du behöver ha goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska. Innan anställning beslutas genomförs en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).
 



  





 Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar. Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar. Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se
 



  





*Bankgirot samarbetar med Safemind för denna rekrytering.*

title: E-commerce Manager
company_industry: Online and Mail Order Retail, Retail, and Wholesale
description:
*Har du förmågan att med ett strategiskt mindset omsätta digitala strategier till lönsam tillväxt? Har du dessutom ett starkt track record inom E-handel och vill vara med på en häftig tillväxtresa med stora möjligheter att påverka? Då kan detta vara tjänsten för dig!* 




  





 SWATI Cosmetics är ett svenskt skönhetsvarumärke med global närvaro och försäljning i över 20 länder via marknadsplatser som Åhléns, Kicks och Sephora, står SWATI nu inför en spännande expansionsfas. SWATI:s produkter är skapade för att passa alla kön, åldrar och etniciteter och speglar varumärkets filosofi om att fira individualitet.
 



  





**Historien om SWATI** 




*”SWATI börjar med två människor som blir kära. Vishal Nanda möter Swati Verma. Boom. Som alla stora kärlekshistorier överskrider den gränser. Vishal är en erfaren svensk entreprenör, Swati en välkänd indisk makeupartist. Han fascineras av hennes utseende och hur det förändras med varje sinnesstämning och tillfälle. Naturligt vacker en dag. Klädd för att imponera nästa. Ändå ser hon alltid ut som sig själv. Självsäker. Stilfull. På ett märkligt sätt verkar till och med hennes ögon förändras. Från ljusa till mörka och tillbaka igen. Han frågar. ”Färgade linser,” svarar hon leende. Resten är, som man säger, historia.”* 




  





**Om rollen** 




 Som E-commerce Manager kliver du in i en spännande roll för bolaget med övergripande ansvar för den digitala försäljningen och tillväxten online. Du kommer att vara kommersiellt drivande och ha ett övergripande ansvar för tillväxten genom datadriven performance marketing. Viktiga fokusområden i rollen är att driva trafik, optimera konvertering och utgå från analyserad data. Du kommer även kravställa samarbetspartner, driva spännande digitala projekt och kontinuerligt optimera kundresa och kundupplevelse. Du arbetar i nära samarbete med teamen inom marknad och försäljning samt övriga kontaktytor i bolaget.
 



 Hittills har bolaget fokuserat på att bygga ett proof of concept, och nu är målet att ta nästa steg och skala verksamheten till nya höjder genom proof of scaling.
 



  





 Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden:
 


* Ansvara för onlineförsäljning och kundupplevelse
* Ansvara för budget, prognos, rapportering och relevanta KPIer
* Driva IT-projektering och teknisk utveckling, särskilt inom Shopify
* Säkerställa varumärkesupplevelsen i den digitala köpkanalen
* Tillsammans med marknadsavdelningen sätta strategi för den digitala kommunikationen ut mot kund, t.ex. nyhetsbrev, onsite, sociala medier, influencer kampanjer mm.
* Löpande analysera både effektivitet och optimering av processer och flöden
* Arbeta nära logistikavdelningen i frågor rörande daglig drift relaterat till e-handelslogistik och distribution
* Delaktig i kravställning av webbyrå, kreativ mediebyrå samt övriga leverantörer
* Bolaget har sitt säte i Stockholm och ett dotterbolag i Indien. Du blir globalt ansvarig för den digitala försäljningen och eventuella resor dit samt kontakter med byråer



  





 I den här rollen är du en central nyckelspelare och driver frågor som rör allt från lager och kampanjer till IT-projekt och säljkampanjer. För att lyckas ser vi att du har en stark teknisk förståelse för Shopify (ett krav) och en bred kunskap inom e-handel.
 



  





**Din bakgrund** 




 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har tidigare erfarenhet som E-commerce Manager, gärna i en mindre organisation i tillväxt, där du arbetat med strategisk planering och operativt genomförande. Som person gillar du att hitta nya sätt att driva utveckling, där dina beslut grundar sig på data och du strävar ständigt efter att förbättra performance. Du är resultatinriktad, har ett nytänkande mindset och en stark känsla för detaljer. Du är dessutom bra på att kommunicera och samarbeta i team, internt som externt. Det viktigaste är att du har rätt personliga egenskaper och känner dig motiverad att arbeta i en snabbfotad miljö med allt vad det innebär.
 



  





 Vi söker dig som har:
 


* Relevant utbildning inom marknadsföring, e-handel, digital kommunikation eller liknande
* Minst 3-5 års erfarenhet av arbete inom e-handel och digital marknadsföring
* Drivit IT-projektering och teknisk utveckling, särskilt inom Shopify
* Ta ägandeskap över den tekniska visionen för e-handeln och planera framtida initiativ
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta säljfokuserat och konverteringsdrivande
* Analytiska färdigheter och förmåga att omvandla data till insikter och implementation av nya och förbättrade ideér
* Teknisk förståelse och förmåga att kravställa byråer och leverantörer
* Förmåga att utmana byråer och leverantörer för att optimera affären
* God kunskap av e-handelsplattformar och verktyg
* God övergripande förståelse för e-handelslogistik och distribution är meriterande
* En entreprenöriell inställning med förmåga att arbeta självständigt och ta initiativ
* En ”office first”-mentalitet, då kontorsnärvaro är viktigt för bolaget
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift



  





**Vad Swati erbjuder** 




 En nyckelroll i ett snabbväxande internationellt skönhetsvarumärke, där du får möjlighet att forma och utveckla strukturer i en expansiv fas. Här blir du en del av en entreprenöriell och dynamisk arbetsmiljö med goda möjligheter till långsiktig karriärutveckling och inflytande.
 



 SWATI Cosmetics har ambitionen att på sikt expandera till nya affärsområden. För rätt person finns möjligheten att vara en del av denna resa som entreprenör och aktivt bidra till framtida framgångar.
 



  





**Placering & Ansökningsprocess** 




 Detta är en heltidstjänst med placering på kontoret i Stockholm och dotterbolag i Indien vilket innebär att resor kommer att förekomma. Du kommer att arbeta i en internationell miljö med samarbetspartners på olika marknader, där det är viktigt med en öppen inställning till kulturella skillnader och en förståelse för arbete över flera tidszoner. Tjänsten startar enligt överenskommelse, gärna så snart som möjligt.
 



  





 Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av E-commerce Recruit och om du har några frågor om rollen är du välkommen att kontakta Lisa Gunnarsson på lisa@ecommercerecruit.se.
 



  





 Vi utvärderar ansökningar löpande, så vi rekommenderar att du skickar in din ansökan tidigt för att bli en del av vår urvalsprocess. Vi ser fram emot att få veta mer om vad du kan bidra med!

title: Product Designer
description:
**Your Mission At Voi**
 As a
 **Product Designer** 
 at Voi, you'll play a pivotal role in enhancing the quality of our operations workflows. You will advocate the voice of our internal users throughout the product development process, ensuring that every design decision aligns with our core values of user-centricity and innovation. Your focus will be on designing intuitive and effective tools that empower our local operational teams to optimise vehicle maintenance and improve their workflow in all our warehouses. As a Product Designer at Voi you will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineering, product management, and operations, to bring products from ideation to reality. To put it into specifics you will:
   

  

* Identify and prioritise user pain points, consistently striving to deliver meaningful solutions that enhance the overall user experience.
* Conduct in-depth user research, leveraging both qualitative and quantitative data sources to gain a deep understanding of user needs and behaviours.
* Lead the way in promoting user insights, actively sharing findings with the team and stakeholders to drive empathy and user-centered thinking throughout the design process.
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends, design standards, and tools relevant to the mobility sector.
* Design and prototype user interfaces using low-fidelity and high-fidelity tools, ensuring that designs are visually appealing and intuitive.
* Facilitate user testing workshops, gathering valuable feedback to refine designs and improve the user experience.


**What You Need To Embark**
 You bring solid experience and skills in Product Design and user-centered principles. At the same time we don’t expect you to know everything. We promote a culture of learning and sharing and we expect all team members to help each other grow professionally. In addition to having strong communication and presentation skills effectively conveying your design ideas to stakeholders, we believe the right person has:
   

  

* Expertise in Figma and other tools we use to bring our designs to life.
* Familiarity with design systems and the ability to contribute to their development.
* Comfort in the gap between physical and digital spaces, where not all the best solutions are screen-based interfaces.
* Experience conducting qualitative user research activities, including user interviews, usability testing, and surveys.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, enabling you to identify and address user needs effectively.
* The ability to zoom in and out, effortlessly navigating from the intricacies of design details to the broader product strategy.
* Fluency in English, both written and verbal.


**WHY VOI?**
 Working At Voi Is More Than Just a Job; Our People Promise Includes a Personal Voiage Where You Will Grow As a Professional And Be a Part Of a Team And Culture That Builds Something Meaningful For Society. In Addition To This You’ll Have The Opportunity To
   

  

* Join Europe’s #1 micromobility operator and one of the fastest growing scaleups.
* Get “skin in the game” through our employee options program and be a part of building a world class organisation and a scalable data platform.
* Work with inspiring, motivated and fun colleagues towards a common goal.
* Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution.


 Since 2018,
 **Voi** 
 has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.
   

  

**Diversity Matters**
 As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly, collaborative and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

title: Workday Lead
description:
**Solve complex problems. Decode the future.**
 At Electrolux Group, as a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together.
   

  

 Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home.
   

  

**All about the role:**
 We are seeking an experienced Workday Lead to join our dynamic People Technologies team.
   

  

 In this role, you will be responsible for driving coordination, alignment, and a holistic approach to the Workday application. You will work closely with different Product Owners who manage specific Workday modules to ensure an aligned roadmap, consistent practices for system configuration and documentation, and seamless releases of both internal enhancements and Workday-delivered updates. You will lead the enhancement and optimization of existing Workday modules from an end-to-end perspective and may also be involved in the future implementation of new modules.
   

  

 This role requires a strong understanding of the Workday ecosystem, excellent project management skills, and a solid grasp of the Agile/Scrum framework. Success in this role hinges on the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, drive and lead without formal authority, and prioritize end-user needs to create a positive user experience within the system.
   

  

 The Workday Lead will report to the Senior Manager, People Technologies & Integration, and will be part of a global team of Product Owners and Analysts working on the implementation, enhancements, design, configuration, and technical support of Workday application.
   

  

**What you'll do:**
* Lead the continuous improvement and optimization of existing Workday modules: Core HCM, Absence, Compensation, Recruitment, and Integrations.
* Own and align the holistic roadmap for the Workday application with Product Owners who manage their respective module roadmaps
* Drive a holistic approach and coordinate efforts across different areas to minimize misalignments and ensure cohesive system enhancements and deployments
* Advocate for an end-to-end holistic approach to system design, protecting the perspective of end users.
* Coordinate releases of enhancements for Workday, both internal and Workday-delivered.
* Work closely with the Change Management team to prepare for the release of impactful functionalities, ensuring technical deployments align with change management efforts.
* Collaborate with the Adoption Specialists to understand system adoption, identify key areas for improvement, and analyze the impact of implemented functionalities.
* Ensure the team follows proper standards and practices for working with the Workday system to keep it clean, organized, and easy to maintain
* Coordinate the utilization of Workday Success Plan components
* Oversee and maintain documentation to adhere to established standards for the Workday system.
* Stay current with Workday updates and new features, and recommend enhancements to improve system functionality.
* Manage tasks and projects within a Scrum/Agile framework.


**Qualifications** 
**:**
* Strong understanding of Workday HCM modules and functionality, with a minimum of 5 years of experience.
* Proven project management skills with the ability to lead complex projects from inception to completion.
* Experience working within a Scrum/Agile framework. Scrum Master certification will be considered a significant plus.
* Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
* Excellent English skills; additional languages such as Spanish or Portuguese would be considered a plus.
* Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
* Ability to lead and manage progress with other team members without formal leadership authority.
* Ability to oversee and align efforts across different modules to ensure cohesive delivery.
* Ability to work independently with limited supervision.
* Workday certification(s) in one or more modules (HCM Core, Recruitment, Compensation, Time Tracking, Absence, US Payroll, Integrations, Extend) will be considered a significant plus.


**Where you'll be:**
 You will be based at Electrolux office in Stockholm (Sweden) or Cracow (Poland).
   

  

**Benefit highlights include:**
* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment.
* Attractive social benefits package.
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path.


 We look forward to receiving you application!
   

  

 As part of Electrolux, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.

title: Head of SEO
company_industry: Advertising Services, Marketing Services, and Technology, Information and Media
description:
*Do you thrive on leading SEO strategies that drive real business impact? Are you ready to take ownership of a growing team and help some of the biggest brands in the Nordics excel in organic search?*
 Then you might be our new Head of SEO!
   

  

**Build and grow our SEO team while driving client success**
 As Head of SEO at s360/Docklin - part of s360, you will take on a pivotal role in our highly specialized SEO team. You will be responsible for setting the strategic direction for SEO, managing key client relationships, and building a team in Stockholm. You will also work closely with other disciplines within digital marketing, such as paid media and data analytics, to create holistic growth strategies.
   

  

**Moreover, You Can Look Forward To**
* Shaping SEO strategy and execution: Define and drive SEO strategies for some of the biggest e-commerce and enterprise brands in the Nordics, ensuring measurable organic success.
* Managing high-impact clients: Oversee a portfolio of clients and act as a trusted advisor to CMOs, Heads of Digital, and other stakeholders.
* Leading and mentoring: Grow and build our team of SEO specialists, fostering a culture of collaboration and continuous learning.
* Driving innovation: Leverage s360 cutting-edge python-led and standalone SEO tools to keep clients ahead of competitors.
* Collaboration across teams: Work alongside other digital marketing specialists, analysts, and developers to ensure a seamless, data-driven approach to growth.


**Join our ambitious journey!**
 You will be joining one of Scandinavia’s largest SEO teams consisting of 50+ experts who collaborate daily to drive growth for our clients. You’ll, however, be the first SEO person in our Stockholm office. s360 acquired Docklin in early 2025 and you’ll join the team with the responsibility of building and growing the SEO offering, both in terms of revenue and team size. We have big ambitions.
   

  

 We are proud of our award-winning SEO cases, which have received major industry recognition for excellence in search and content strategy.
   

  

**SEO leader with a proactive and innovative mindset**
 We seek a strategic, experienced SEO leader who can drive results while fostering a high-performance team environment.
   

  

**To The Role You Will Bring**
* 6+ years of experience in SEO with a proven track record of driving results for enterprise-level clients.
* Strong leadership skills, with experience managing and mentoring SEO teams.
* Expertise in Strategic & Technical SEO, including site architecture, crawling, indexing, and content strategies.
* A consultative approach with the ability to engage and influence senior stakeholders.
* Proficiency in English and Swedish, both written and spoken.
* Experience with leading SEO tools such as Ahrefs, Screaming Frog, Google Search Console, and Analytics.
* A data-driven mindset, using insights to make strategic decisions and optimize performance.
* A strong understanding of cross-channel digital marketing, including paid search, social, and analytics.


**What It Is Like Working At S360**
 You will help shape the development of one of the Nordic’s leading and fastest-growing consulting firms within digital marketing, tech and data. You will be part of a strong team with some of the country's best specialists, all striving to make each delivery better than the last.
   

  

 What sets us apart is our vibrant team culture. Throughout the year, we host social events such as Friday bars, sports tournaments and more. We organize meetups with all our offices from around the world and have special interest communities ranging from Counter-Strike and running clubs to kitesurfing and knitting.
   

  

**Join Us And Experience**
* Adown-to-earth culture where constructive feedback and collaboration drive success.
* Freedom with responsibility, including flexible working hours.
* Exciting, high-impact projects, working with some of the biggest brands in the Nordics.
* A high-expertise environment where you can develop alongside top professionals in digital marketing.


**We’d love to hear from you**
 Is this the right fit for you? Do you have any questions? Then don’t hesitate to apply or reach out to Erik Östberg at [email protected].
   

  

 We review applications on an ongoing basis and hire as soon as the right candidate is found, so please send your CV and application as soon as possible. All inquiries are treated confidentially.
   

  

**About S360**
 s360 is a leading Northern European digital marketing agency that helps brands and retailers grow by providing a strong tech foundation, best-in-class execution, and deep industry expertise. With a team of +330 digital specialists, s360 operates ten offices across seven countries: Denmark, Finland, Norway, Sweden, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, and Spain. In recent years, s360 has been recognised with numerous national and European awards, making it one of Europe's most award-winning digital marketing agencies.

title: Entrepreneurial Head of Growth
company_industry: Financial Services, Software Development, and Data Infrastructure and Analytics
description:
**About Pinpoint Estimates** 




 Pinpoint Estimates is a Stockholm-based fintech company on a mission to bring greater transparency to capital markets. Our open platform crowdsources financial estimates from private investors for publicly listed companies across the Nordics. We provide unique, forward-looking insights to listed companies, financial institutions, and individual investors, powering better decisions with collective intelligence.
 



 As we scale, we're looking for someone who combines commercial instinct with operational follow-through, someone who can spot opportunities, shape strategy, and then roll up their sleeves to make it happen.
 



  





**🌟 About the role** 




 This is a role for someone who brings a
 *founder’s mindset* 
 and isn’t afraid to lead growth hands-on. You’ll define go-to-market strategies, build client relationships, close strategic deals, and shape the future of our commercial offerings.
 



  





 We imagine you might be:
 


* A founder looking for your next venture or an entrepreneurial operator ready to take full ownership
* A builder who thrives in early-stage environments where speed, ownership, and adaptability are key
* Passionate about fintech, data, capital markets, and the new ways we engage investors



  





**🧩 What you’ll do** 



* **Own revenue** 
 : Take full responsibility for driving revenue across our key products: IR solutions, market data, and investor products.
* **Shape the offer:** 
 Evolve our value proposition based on client feedback, competitive intelligence, and market trends. Identify and develop new revenue opportunities, partnerships, and distribution channels.
* **Work with founders:** 
 Collaborate closely with the CEO and product team to align commercial and product strategy
* **Close strategic partnerships:** 
 Engage with senior stakeholders at listed companies, financial institutions, and potential distribution partners
* **Operate lean:** 
 You won’t have a large team (yet), you’ll thrive by being resourceful and hands-on



  





**✅ What we're looking for** 



* **Founder mindset** 
 : You’ve built something yourself or have held a role with full commercial responsibility
* **Strong communicator** 
 : You know how to build trust quickly and pitch ideas clearly at all levels
* **Capital markets savvy** 
 : You understand how listed companies, IR, and financial data interact (or are eager to learn fast)
* **Proven closer** 
 : You know how to drive a B2B sales process from lead to signed contract
* **Strategic + scrappy** 
 : You can design a go-to-market plan
 *and* 
 send the cold emails to execute it
* **Autonomous operator** 
 : You thrive with a high degree of freedom and accountability



  





**🎁 What you get** 



* A key role in shaping a fast-growing fintech with real traction
* Direct influence on product, strategy, and growth
* Competitive compensation, pension and equity package
* A modern and flexible work environment in a small, ambitious team
* The chance to grow with the company and build something meaningful

title: Senior Relationship Manager- Real Estate and Construction, DNB Sweden
description:
People are the very DNA of DNB. Since 1822, bright minds have worked together to find the best solutions for our customers. Today, DNB is much more than Norway's largest bank – we are a technology-driven financial institution that continuously connects people and ideas to knowledge and capital in new ways.
   

  

 Diversity is part of who we are, and inclusion is something we actively choose every single day. We promise to do our best to make you feel at home. A job at Norway's largest financial group offers professional challenges in an exciting work environment with many opportunities for development.
   

  

 Are you passionate about the Swedish Real Estate market? Are you passionate about developing and maintaining strong relationship between DNB and our existing and future clients? Your strategic approach will involve understanding client needs, ensuring their satisfaction, and identifying opportunities for business growth. We are now looking for an experienced Senior Relationship Manager who will play an important role on this journey, contributing with proactivity, enthusiasm and Real Estate & financial structuring competence to the team.
   

  

**The Real Estate Division** 
 covers DNB's large customers within Real Estate and Construction. We are approximately 50 people across our offices in Sweden, Norway and Internationally, with the ambition to be the leading financial partner within our segments, focusing on strong industry competence, compliance and sustainability. Cooperation with DNB Markets and other parts of DNB are critical to reach our strategic and financial targets.
   

  

 Real Estate Division serves clients across the globe and focusing on the Nordic Real Estate market. We are 15 dedicated Client Managers and Client Advisors in Sweden and Norway working together to serve the Scandinavian market. In Stockholm you will be one of a team of Client Managers and Analysts working closely with dedicated credit analysts as part of the wider team. The section has a very high deal activity, and we are cooperating closely with DNB Carnegie (IBD, FICC and Equities) and Working Capital Solutions. We emphasize industry competence and taking advantage of the dynamics of a truly global team.
   

  

 In this role you will cooperate with the global team and have an important role in contributing with industry expertise and market knowledge out of the Stockholm office. You will have responsibility for a portfolio of customers and to expand that portfolio with new attractive companies.
   

  

**Your main responsibilities:**
* Drive profitable growth through origination of new customers and business opportunities.
* Develop and lead client relationships, including taking a strategic view on the customer’s capital structure, pitching for lending and other cross selling activities and coordinating with the relevant product specialists.
* Ability to execute all kind of transactions, independently and drive a process from pitch to closing.
* Take ownership of the credit risk assessment, structure deals and develop term sheets.
* Take responsibility of the documentation process of a deal, including reviewing loan agreements and coordinating stakeholders.
* Develop and maintain strong industry knowledge, which includes broadening networks with relevant industry participants
* Possess and continuously develop strong industry knowledge.
* Have a hands-on oversight of KYC procedures and non-financial risk assessments.


**Competence requirements:**
* Higher academic education in business or equivalent
* Fluent in spoken and written English
* In-depth knowledge of large corporate banking products, capital markets and capital-efficient solutions
* Relevant experience and good business understanding.
* Ability to initiate and build relationships both external and internal.
* Strong knowledge and network of contacts within the Nordic real estate market
* Pro-active, structured and result-oriented.


**Personal qualities:**
 You possess good inter-personal and communication skills and can promote, leverage and maintain internal/external networks. You are an advocate of change and innovation and should strive to find process improvements and promote innovation wherever possible.
   

  

**We offer**
 DNB strives to create a workplace where people thrive and feel safe. We believe that equality and inclusion boost innovative thinking and collective competency which contributes to create an attractive and flexible company equipped for a changeable business landscape.
   

  

 Our premises are centrally located in Stockholm and we apply “hybrid work place”.
   

  

**Application**
 Please send in your application as soon as possible, but no later than no later than 23th of June 2025. We process applications continuously.
   

  

 If you have any questions regarding the position, please reach out to Head of Real Estate , Sweden, Leif Lanke, leif.lanke@dnb.se. If you have questions regarding you application and process, please contact People Partner, Sofia Elgstedt, sofia.elgstedt@dnb.se
   

  

 We are looking forward receiving your application!
   

  

**Local Trade union:**
 Finansförbundet: Erik Svensson Rova, erik.svensson-rova@dnb.se
   

  

 Akademikerförbunden: Charlotte Löfgren, charlotte.lofgren@dnb.se
   

  

 As a qualitative part of DNB’s recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the work environment, and meet regulatory requirements.
   

  

 In this job application process, you only need to upload your resume (CV) and briefly answer some job-related questions. Cover letter is not required but you can upload this as an attachment if desired.
   

  

 As an employer, DNB encourages all forms of internal mobility, including recruitment, job rotation, and special assignments. This is an opportunity for you to embrace new career challenges within the company and gain valuable personal and professional development. Some positions are only posted internally and are exclusive to DNB employees.
   

  

 When applying for a position it is only the hiring manager and HR who have access to your application.

title: Erfaren CFO till Internationellt Techbolag
description:
**Erfaren CFO till Internationellt Techbolag** 




  





 Vi söker en erfaren CFO till ett väletablerat Techbolag där du får möjlighet att ta det
 



 övergripande ansvaret för ekonomi, risk, legal och IT i en organisation med stabil grund,
 



 långsiktiga kundrelationer och kontinuerlig tillväxt.
 



  





 Vi söker dig som har gedigen erfarenhet som CFO, gärna från börsnoterade bolag och med
 



 vana att arbeta i internationella miljöer. Du har drivit förvärv och andra M&A-processer och
 



 är strategisk och analytisk med mycket goda kunskaper inom finansiell analys, prognosarbete och rapportering.
 



  





 Som ledare är du trygg, strukturerad och van att organisera komplexa verksamheter. Du har
 



 utmärkta kommunikativa egenskaper och trivs med samarbete i ledningsgrupper.
 



 Du är van vid att arbeta i finansiella system samt har en relevant akademisk examen inom
 



 ekonomi eller finans, gärna kompletterad med en masterexamen eller MBA.
 



  





 Placeringsort: Centrala Stockholm
 



 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning
 



  





 För mer information, kontakta Mickey Dhillon på 073-738 34 90 eller
 



 mickey@peoplegroup.se.

title: Tekniknära förvaltare till analysplattformar
company_industry: Civil Engineering, Government Administration, and Truck Transportation
description:
Är du intresserad av IT och cybersäkerhet samt vill vara med och skydda det svenska transportsystemet? Då kan du vara den vi söker!
   

  

 Som
 **Tekniknära förvaltare** 
 på Trafikverket är du med och underlättar vardagen för invånare och företagare i hela Sverige. Det gör du genom att vara med och bidra till framtidens infrastruktur och får möjlighet att ingå i vår organisation som bedriver en av landets mest komplexa och omfattande it verksamheter och ansvarar för flera samhällsviktiga it tjänster.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 I den här rollen är du en del i ett engagerat team som förvaltar myndighetens analysplattformar. Du arbetar med att vidareutveckla och effektivisera vår tekniska infrastruktur.
   

  

 Den ökade digitaliseringen har öppnat upp oändliga möjligheter men har samtidigt gett upphov till helt nya risker och hot. På enheten Säkerhetsplattformar bidrar du inte bara till att skydda Trafikverkets digitala landskap, du bidrar till att skydda hela det svenska transportsystemet.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifterna omfattar bland annat:
   

  

* ge underlag till planeringen för förvaltningen inklusive resursbehov och ekonomisk kalkyl
* skapa de rätta förutsättningarna för att förvaltningen ska kunna leverera, genom att främja psykologisk trygghet, delaktighet och engagemang
* planera och leda arbetet samt följa upp och säkerhetsställa att förvaltningen sker enligt överenskomna krav och leveransnivåer
* säkerhetsställa att all teknisk dokumentation finns framtagen och uppdaterad för ingående IT-lösningar
* hantera eskaleringar inom förvaltningen och eliminera hinder
* planera och följa upp IT-förändringar samt säkerställa att ingående aktiviteter genomförs
* hantera identifierade fel, IT-incidenter, IT-problem och förbättringsförslag
* omvärldsbevaka samt fånga och framföra idéer gällande teknikutvecklingens möjligheter
* fånga och analysera IT-behov
* samverka med angränsande förvaltningar
* rapportera status i förvaltningen


 För att möta framtidens risker och hot prioriterar vi medarbetarnas utveckling. Genom externa och interna utbildningar ger vi dig det stöd du behöver för din kompetensutveckling.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 För att lyckas i rollen behöver du ha god samarbetsförmåga och drivas av en vilja att utvecklas och nå framgång tillsammans med andra. Vidare tar du initiativ och ansvar för dina uppgifter och har förmågan att skapa engagemang och delaktighet. Du har ett stort intresse för teknik och du leder och motiverar dina teammedlemmar i det som krävs för att effektiv nå gemensamma mål och du hittar lösningar på uppkomna dilemman.
   

  

 Du motiveras av ett aktivt medarbetarskap där du på ett målmedvetet sätt tar ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter samtidigt som du är uppmärksam på hur du är en del av och bidrar till helheten genom att samverka med andra.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* yrkeserfarenhet som teamledare för ett agilt team inom drift eller it-förvaltning
* eftergymnasial utbildning med inriktning data/IT alternativt annan relevant utbildning tillsammans med arbetslivserfarenhet som vi bedömer likvärdig
* mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, i tal och skrift
* goda kunskaper i engelska, i tal och skrift


 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av något av följande:
   

  

* scrummaster
* SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework)
* it-säkerhetsarbete
* kännedom om Splunk Enterprise och Splunk Enterprise Security eller motsvarande produkter


**Övrig information**
 De frågor som du får besvara när du skickar in din ansökan kommer att ligga till grund för det första urvalet vi gör. Om det inte står något annat i annonsen vill vi att du bifogar ditt CV. Vi har slutat begära in personligt brev eftersom vi inte har med det som del av urvalsunderlaget.
   

  

 Önskar du att arbeta delvis på distans? I den här tjänsten kan det finnas möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån upp till 40 procent av din arbetstid.
   

  

 I denna rekrytering används webbaserade tester som en del i urvalet.
   

  

 Vi använder främst mail (från mejladress: noreply@heroma.se) för att göra utskick och kallelser. Kolla din inkorg och även skräppost/SPAM regelbundet under denna tid för att vara säker på att du får all information från oss! För att undvika att information gällande din ansökan klassas som SPAM kan du med fördel lägga till vår e-postadress: noreply@heroma.se i dina e-postkontakter.
   

  

 Preliminär tidplan:
   

  

 Tester skickas ut den 19 juni
   

  

 Intervjuer är planerade till XXX
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Inom vår IT-organisation är du med och utvecklar Sverige med hjälp av moderna och innovativa lösningar. Vi är mitt i en spännande förändring där vi försöker ta vara på digitaliseringens möjligheter till fullo. Digitaliseringen ställer allt större krav och vi vill därför anpassa oss vad gäller kompetens, arbetssätt och organisation i takt med utvecklingen. Vi har ett helhetsansvar för IT och telekom, en verksamhet som pågår dygnet runt, året om - precis som Sveriges transportsystem.
   

  

 På Trafikverket jobbar vi med att göra Sverige närmare. Vi tror på att en förening av olika erfarenheter, bakgrunder och perspektiv är den bästa grunden för att bygga en arbetsplats fri från diskriminering och en miljö där alla trivs och gör sitt bästa. Vi tror på mångfald där den gemensamma nämnaren är pålitlighet, engagemang och mod. För det är så vi bäst representerar vårt samhälle.

title: Finance Manager
description:
**About the role** 




  





 As a CBRE Finance Manager you will provide financial management and governance for one of our client accounts, ensuring appropriate and adequate financial management and controls to meet all client and CBRE requirements.
 



  





 As a key member of the finance team, you will actively drive the region to ensure it meets the targets set through exceptional client and CBRE operational team engagement and service.
 



  





 Specific areas of focus will include financial reporting (both client and internal), annual planning, quarterly reforecasting, driving added-value financial opportunities and risk mitigation, and ongoing analysis as required. This role requires exceptional client-facing and operational stakeholder engagement skills, whilst balancing the demands of ongoing corporate responsibilities. Working within the financial contractual requirements and meeting all deadlines will be a key deliverable of the role.
 



  





**What you´ll do:** 




  





**Client Management** 



* Develop high quality and effective client relationships in the region.
* Build excellent working relationships with account management and key client’s members and be a business partner for both.
* Tightly manage contract governance, demonstrating an in-depth knowledge of the terms and conditions of the contract to ensure that all cost elements are appropriately accounted for.
* Assist with client team requests in a timely and accurate manner.
* Positively respond to both our internal and external customers (often in a matrix environment) through effective communication and personal accessibility and credibility.
* Support regional operational teams in weekly / monthly client meetings and presentations.
* Deliver the region’s client budget and regular forecasts, working closely with operations teams to ensure full understanding and high degree of accuracy.



  





**Financial Reporting** 



* Responsible for the preparation of all monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting, both from a client and CBRE perspective.
* Responsible for the preparation of all supplementary financial analysis and commentary, including the preparation of detailed balance sheet reconciliations.
* Ownership of all financial transaction postings, ensuring accurate and timely delivery of all client invoices and month end accruals.
* Ownership of the region’s risks & opportunities, keeping finance and operational teams fully appraised of key items on a regular basis.
* Provide ad-hoc support and financial analysis as required.
* Ensure delivery of region’s corporate budget/targets.



  





**Contract and Finance Management** 



* Continually review, maintain, and improve cash-flow, margins, and reporting.
* Ensure timely invoicing of client and management of AR through PowerBI, ensuring it accurately reflects the region’s AR position. Drive actions to ensure any overdue debt is settled by the client promptly.
* Identify and help drive the implementation of savings opportunities to ensure client is achieving best value for money.
* Review client P&L results and ensure consistency with CBRE reporting.
* Active management of overheads whilst seeking areas for efficiencies and savings.
* Attend and present at monthly client and internal financial review meetings as required.
* Constantly improve quality, service, and efficiency within the region.
* Communicate regularly with the operations team to ensure they are fully informed of operational objectives and achievements, and operational performance feeds back into the financial results.
* Support in any client related audits.



  





**Finance Processes, Procedures and Reporting** 



* Ensure company policies and procedures are adhered to consistently throughout the contract.
* Ensure relevant financial policies and procedures for the delivery of our contractual arrangements with the client are in place and effectively communicated to the client.
* Manage the integrity of data in CBRE GWS systems.
* Manage all compliance through the required procedures and processes.
* Develop an understanding of how to best utilise GWS system-generated reporting capabilities.



  





**Finance Planning** 



* Assist the finance and operations teams to deliver all CBRE and client related annual planning. This will include the preparation of all presentational material and in gaining the relevant internal and client approvals.



  





**Financial Governance** 



* Ensure CBRE and statutory obligations are met for reporting and governance purposes.
* Responsible for ensuring the integrity of the balance sheet and balance sheet commentary for the region.
* Drive any GWS transformation and client initiatives, working closely with other functions to ensure full alignment of deliverables and results.



  





**People Management** 



* Lead, motivate and develop the Sweden Finance Team.
* Carry out structured appraisals and ensure personal development plans are in place and include succession plans.
* Empower team members to take responsibility and accountability.
* Supervise and review performance of individuals in the team.



  





**What you´ll need:** 




  





**Education** 



* Hold a relevant educational qualification



  





**Skills** 



* Highly computer literate
* Ability to combine strategic vision with hands-on, pragmatic delivery.
* IT Skills to achieve key tasks and give the business a sound reporting base.
* Superior written and verbal communication skills with strong oral presentation skills
* Swedish and English speaking
* Capable of working in a matrix environment



  





**Experience** 



* Worked in a complex multinational company with hands on experience of managing teams across countries
* Track record of achieving results through others.
* Proven commercial acumen and ability to contribute to decision-making.
* Management skills to maximise the performance of staff working directly for them and others
* Experience of Iscala and PeopleSoft



  





**Aptitude** 



* Ability to shape, lead and influence other senior managers
* Well developed, effective communication skills enabling the individual to work with board members, clients, suppliers, and staff at all levels and of all abilities
* Self-motivated and ambitious
* Results/ task orientated, with attention to detail and accuracy
* Excellent time management and organisational skills
* Commitment to continuous improvement
* Ability to work as part of a team, as well as independently
* Committed to customer service delivery
* Able to make sound decisions when needed and take accountability for outcomes
* Calm manner, able to work under pressure and with changing demands and priorities
* Confidential and discrete approach

title: Head of Growth
description:
**Company Description**
*Publicis Groupe is one of the largest communications groups in the world. We are building the agency model of the future and take a holistic approach to our clients’ challenges. By fusing together our media, creative, data and technology expertise, we are able to provide clients with integrated solutions, transformative ideas and compelling consumer experiences. We call it the Power of One.*
*We are proud winner of many awards and nominations, both in Sweden and internationally. But nothing makes us prouder than to work with clients and brands such as* 
*P&G, Disney, H&M, Elgiganten, Mondelez, Volvo, VISA, Lantmännen, LEGO, Spotify, Perrigo, Renault and many more.*
*At Publicis, we put our people first. We are proud to be certified by Great Place to Work (2022, 2023, 2024, 2025), and have been recognized with a Magnet Award for our engaging culture (2023). Our goal is to become the leading workplace in our industry. We are based in a fantastic office in Odenplan, but also offer a flexible work policy.*
**Overview**
 Publicis Media, part of Publicis Groupe, is now looking for a Head of Growth, leading newbiz on the Swedish market. This is a unique and exciting opportunity for a result- and relationship-oriented leader, passionate about newbiz and with extensive media agency experience. The Head of Growth will be key to growth and the future success of Publicis Media. The role is based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**New Business Leadership:**
* Development of newbiz Strategy and plan and leadership of Nordic regional and local media pitches as well as global pitches in the Nordic region.
* Ensure newbiz success through strong market activity, excellent pitch work, motivated teams, and best-in-class presentations.
* Be the internal champion for growth and build a culture of winning, where pitching is fun and fuels the development of our people and great work.


**Prospecting**
* Ensure a continuous strong prospecting strategy; a proactive and organized approach to identifying targets and turning new opportunities into Publicis clients.
* Develop and maintain great relationships with clients, prospects, pitch consultants, and auditors.


**Team**
* Together with Agency Lead and internal stakeholders, ensure that we have strong and motivated pitch teams.
* Provide strategic and operational leadership; inspire confidence and coach the teams to deliver their best work.
* Make sure that goals, roles, responsibilities, and deadlines are clear and that we have an efficient use of internal resources.


**Process & Quality**
* Ensure a clear and efficient process for running new business pitches, a process that is continuously updated and improved as we get new learnings.
* Lead pitch orchestration together with key stakeholders.
* Ensure high quality in all newbiz work, from process to content and presentation.
* Continuously implement learnings from previous pitches to improve our newbiz work and conversion/success rate.


**Commercials**
* Support Nordic Commercial Director with contract negotiations with clients and their procurement team


**Strategy & Storytelling**
* Together with our Chief Strategy Officer, lead the evolution of the Publicis narrative in pitches.
* Partner with Global Business Development team and central capability teams to ensure that we use the right frameworks, tools and models.
* Work closely together with internal and Nordic stakeholders to build solutions that integrate capabilities across the group and deliver best-in-class Power of One solutions.


**Qualifications**
* You have min least 7 years’ experience in media/marketing and a solid knowledge of marketing, media strategy, media planning and buying, digital development, performance, data and technology. You have a good understanding and interest in data, analytics, tech and ai with focus on the value it can bring to our clients.
* You have experience in developing and implementing successful media strategies and campaigns on a local and/or Nordic level. You know how to drive change for companies, brands, and people, and translating strategy into concrete solutions to fuel growth for clients.
* You have a successful track record in new business development from a media agency and are ambitious with a passion for winning. You possess a commercial mindset and always strive for business growth.
* You are great at building relationships. You are a true team player who loves to collaborate/partner with colleagues, clients, pitch consultants, media vendors and other partners. You enjoy motivating people and to build high-performing teams.
* You have exceptional interpersonal, presentation and communication skills, both written and verbal. You are a great storyteller and can explain complex things in simple ways to make people understand and follow your guidance.
* You are strategic and operational with strong problem-solving skills; very result- and solution-oriented, self-driven, and epitomize a “can-do” attitude with a positive drive. You can easily roll up your sleeves and produce work as well as lead you team to deliver on goals and plans.
* You are well organized and perform well in a fast-paced environment, under pressure, and with tight deadlines.
* You are curious, embrace change, and foster a culture of learning and constant development. You can easily come up with new, innovative thinking.
* You are fluent in Swedish and English and thrive in an international setting.


**Additional Information**
 In addition to a welcoming culture and inclusive environment with passionate colleagues we offer you:
   

  

**Career Opportunities**
 Local and Global opportunities through the Power Of One.
   

  

**Personal and Professional Learning**
 Global AI learning platform where you can participate in +30 000 classes and connect with colleagues from all over the world.
   

  

**Flexible Ways of Working**
 We want to be an employer where work life balance is cherished. We love to spend time with our colleagues at the office but also believe in the output of your work not where the work is being done.
   

  

**Work Your World**
 For six weeks a year, the world is yours. Every employee can work anywhere on the planet where there's a Publicis office. A new city, a favorite locale, or even a different country - Go. Grow. Explore.
   

  

**Mental Health**
 The happiness and health of our people is paramount to us. We work continuously on maintaining a healthy and safe working environment through initiatives that facilitate the well-being of our employees.
   

  

**Benefits**
 Generous benefit package.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Strategic Sales Director / Deal Maker
job_function: Sales, Business Development, and Customer Service
description:
**Who We Are**
 At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward – always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities.
   

  

**The Role**
 Join Kyndryl as a
 **Strategic Sales Director / Deal Maker** 
 and take your career to new heights. We are seeking an exceptional individual who thrives in a fast-paced, high-stakes environment, where every deal is an opportunity to make a significant impact.
   

  

 As a
 **Strategic Sales Director / Deal Maker** 
 at Kyndryl, you will be at the forefront of our sales activities, leading deals from qualification to closure for complex, multi-tower multi-million deals. This is your chance to shape opportunities, paving the way for groundbreaking negotiations with top-level executives, including CxOs and closing deals. You will have the opportunity to demonstrate your expertise in determining pricing and commercial strategies, leveraging insights from our team of pricing experts.
   

  

 In this role, you will be the driving force behind the success in our Core and Strategic accounts, where you will create Kyndryl's unique and compelling propositions tailored to meet market demands and customer requirements. Collaboration will be key as you work closely with internal stakeholders to gather the necessary documents and technical solutions for bid submissions. Your exceptional skills in deal crafting will be put to the test as you define winning propositions and lead the end-to-end response for complex deals.
   

  

 Your passion for profitable growth will shine through as you lead contract negotiations to ensure not only the best outcome for our organization but also for your clients. You will play a crucial role with both new and existing customers, acting as a bridge between our talented teams throughout the deal process and the customer organisation.
   

  

 A core part of your responsibilities will involve compiling, refining, and owning the final proposal documents, showcasing your ability to present technical content and designs in a professional and concise manner. Your keen eye for detail and commitment to excellence will be instrumental in establishing a robust reporting and governance process to monitor the success of our deals.
   

  

 Are you ready to work with the best team and lead the engagement with our most important customers? At Kyndryl, we believe in empowering our employees to reach their full potential. As a
 **Strategic Sales Director / Deal Maker** 
 , you will have the unique opportunity to shape the future of our business by driving key initiatives and building lasting relationships with high-value clients. This role is perfect for a visionary leader who is passionate about sales and committed to excellence. Join us and be part of a dynamic environment where innovation, collaboration, and success are at the forefront of everything we do.
   

  

 Join us in revolutionizing the industry as we standardize pitches across a diverse portfolio of industries. Your expertise in creating differentiated propositions aligned with market requirements will play a vital role in our continued growth and success. If you are ready to make a profound impact, drive transformative deals, and work alongside a team of dedicated professionals, this is the opportunity you've been waiting for. Come aboard and unleash your potential as a
 **Strategic Sales Director / Deal Maker** 
 with us!
   

  

 Your Future at Kyndryl
   

  

 Every position at Kyndryl offers a way forward to grow your career. We have opportunities that you won’t find anywhere else, including hands-on experience, learning opportunities, and the chance to certify in all four major platforms. Whether you want to broaden your knowledge base or narrow your scope and specialize in a specific sector, you can find your opportunity here.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You’re good at what you do and possess the required experience to prove it. However, equally as important – you have a growth mindset; keen to drive your own personal and professional development. You are customer-focused – someone who prioritizes customer success in their work. And finally, you’re open and borderless – naturally inclusive in how you work with others.
   

  

**Required Skills and Experience:**
* Develop Large-Scale Sales Strategies: Create and implement strategies specifically tailored to secure large deals and high-value clients, aligning with Kyndryl's mission to transform IT infrastructure.
* Experience: Minimum of 8-10 years of managerial experience in sales, with a focus on large-scale deals.
* Evaluate Sales Programs: Assess the effectiveness of current sales programs and make necessary adjustments to improve outcomes.
* Customer Relationship Management: Build and maintain relationships with key clients and stakeholders, focusing on long-term partnerships and leveraging Kyndryl's global expertise.
* Market Analysis: Monitor market trends, competitor activities, and customer needs to identify new business opportunities.
* Complex Sales Cycles: Organize, manage, and forecast complex sales cycles, ensuring timely and successful deal closures.
* Lead Deals from Qualification to Closure: Lead deals from qualification to closure for complex, multi-tower multi-million deals, shaping opportunities and paving the way for groundbreaking negotiations with top-level executives, including CxOs.
* Determine Pricing and Commercial Strategies: Demonstrate your expertise in determining pricing and commercial strategies, leveraging insights from our team of pricing experts.
* Create Compelling Propositions: Create Kyndryl's unique and compelling propositions tailored to meet market demands and customer requirements.
* Collaborate with Internal Stakeholders: Work closely with internal stakeholders to gather the necessary documents and technical solutions for bid submissions.
* Lead Contract Negotiations: Lead contract negotiations to ensure the best outcome for our organization and clients.
* Compile and Refine Proposal Documents: Compile, refine, and own the final proposal documents, showcasing your ability to present technical content and designs in a professional and concise manner.
* Establish Reporting and Governance Processes: Establish a robust reporting and governance process to monitor the success of our deals.


**Preferred Skills and Experience:**
* Education: Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, or a related field.
* Experience: Minimum of 8-10 years of managerial experience in sales, with a focus on large-scale deals.
* Skills: Strong leadership, strategic planning, negotiation, and communication skills.
* Knowledge: Deep understanding of sales processes, market dynamics, and customer relationship management.
* Industry-Specific Solution Expertise: High level of industry-specific solution expertise and proficiency in sales techniques.
* Bid Activities and Deals: Proven experience in conceptualizing and executing bid activities and deals.
* Customer Negotiations: 10+ years of experience in leading customer negotiations.


**Being You**
 Diversity is a whole lot more than what we look like or where we come from, it’s how we think and who we are. We welcome people of all cultures, backgrounds, and experiences. But we’re not doing it single-handily: Our Kyndryl Inclusion Networks are only one of many ways we create a workplace where all Kyndryls can find and provide support and advice. This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you – and everyone next to you – the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture. That’s the Kyndryl Way.
   

  

**What You Can Expect**
 With state-of-the-art resources and Fortune 100 clients, every day is an opportunity to innovate, build new capabilities, new relationships, new processes, and new value. Kyndryl cares about your well-being and prides itself on offering benefits that give you choice, reflect the diversity of our employees and support you and your family through the moments that matter – wherever you are in your life journey. Our employee learning programs give you access to the best learning in the industry to receive certifications, including Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Skillsoft, and many more. Through our company-wide volunteering and giving platform, you can donate, start fundraisers, volunteer, and search over 2 million non-profit organizations. At Kyndryl, we invest heavily in you, we want you to succeed so that together, we will all succeed.
   

  

**Get Referred!**
 If you know someone that works at Kyndryl, when asked ‘How Did You Hear About Us’ during the application process, select ‘Employee Referral’ and enter your contact's Kyndryl email address.

title: Group Financial Controller
description:
Är du en engagerad och driven Group Financial Controller som vill bidra till detta kompetenta team med dina kunskaper och erfarenheter? Har du gedigna redovisningskunskaper och vill ta detta tillfälle i akt och bli en del av denna växande organisation? Nu söker vi en Group Financial Controller med ett nyfiket och engagerat sinnelag
 



  





**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter och ansvarsområden som Group Financial Controller:** 



* Koncernredovisning och rapportering inklusive delårsrapporter och årsredovisningar enligt IFRS
* Sammanställa och rapportera finansiell information till externa intressenter samt samarbeta med revisorer för att åtgärda eventuella brister och förbättra redovisningsprocessen.
* Tillsammans med Head of Financial Control ta fram och säkerställa kvaliteten i likviditetsprognoser för koncernen
* Driva olika förbättringsprojekt inom redovisning och rapportering
* Löpande analysera och säkerställa kvalitén av redovisningen för moder- och dotterbolag samt efterlevnad av interna kontroller och rutiner.



  





**Kvalifikationer och erfarenhet:** 




 Vi söker dig som har gedigna redovisningskunskaper med grundläggande förståelse för IFRS och viss praktisk erfarenhet av koncernredovisning. Du har troligtvis högskoleutbildning inom företrädesvis ekonomiområdet.
