 Submit your application and supporting documents through the Varbi recruitment system. Use the button in the top right corner and follow the instructions. We prefer that your application is written in English, but you can also apply in Swedish.
   

  

 Your application must contain the following documents:
   

  

* A personal letter and a curriculum vitae
* Degree projects and previous publications, if any
* Any other documentation showing the desirable skills and personal qualities described above
* Documents certifying your general eligibility (see A above)
* Documents certifying your specific eligibility (see B above)


**Selection**
 A selection will be made among eligible applicants on the basis of the ability to benefit from doctoral education. The qualifications of the applicants will be evaluated on an overall basis.
   

  

 Karolinska Institutet uses the following bases of assessment:
   

  

* Documented subject knowledge of relevance to the area of research
* Analytical skill
* Other documented knowledge or experience that may be relevant to doctoral studies in the subject.


 All applicants will be informed when the recruitment is completed.
   

  

 Division of Clinical Microbiology
   

  

 The Systems Virology Lab – Ujjwal Neogi
   

  

**Want to make a difference? Join us and contribute to better health for all**

title: Senior Cloud Architect, ML/AI
description:
**Location**  

Our Senior Cloud Architect will be an integral part of our Cloud Reliability Engineering team in the UK, Ireland, Estonia, Netherlands, Sweden and Spain. The role is also available to contractors in other Eastern European locations / Portugal.


**Who We Are**  

DoiT is a global technology company that works with cloud-driven organizations to leverage the cloud to drive business growth and innovation. We combine data, technology, and human expertise to ensure our customers operate in a well-architected and scalable state - from planning to production.



Delivering DoiT Cloud Intelligence, the only solution that integrates advanced technology with human intelligence, we help our customers solve complex multicloud problems and drive efficiency.



With decades of multicloud experience, we have specializations in Kubernetes, GenAI, CloudOps, and more. An award-winning strategic partner of AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure, we work alongside more than 4,000 customers worldwide.


**The Opportunity**  

As a Senior Cloud Architect, you will be part of our global CRE team, working with rapidly growing companies in EMEA and around the world. This role offers you the chance to:


* Apply your hands-on experience & skills in a consultative manner to address our customers' strategic and tactical needs around cloud technologies
* Grow your technical and interpersonal skills by addressing customer challenges in your daily work and leveraging dedicated time allocated by the company for learning new technologies and engaging in internal initiatives
* Strengthen your personal brand through thought leadership activities such as blogging, public speaking, and participation in technology events


**Qualifications**


**Experience Requirement:**


* Minimum of 4+ years of experience in architecting, deploying, and managing cloud-based AI/ML solutions.


**Core AWS Expertise:**


* Expertise in architecting, developing, and troubleshooting large production-grade distributed systems on AWS, and selecting the appropriate tools to address business problems at the correct scale.
* Advanced proficiency in AWS, with a focus on Generative AI and machine learning services. Certified AWS Solutions Architect Professional and/or AWS Machine Learning Specialty
* Proven track record of architecting, deploying, and optimizing complex cloud solutions for AI-driven workloads.


**Generative AI and Cutting-Edge Technologies:**


* Expertise in Amazon Bedrock for deploying foundation models and managing scalable GenAI workloads.
* Proficiency in fine-tuning and deploying Large Language Models (LLMs) and multimodal AI using Amazon SageMaker JumpStart and Hugging Face on AWS.
* Experience leveraging Amazon Q (formerly AWS CodeWhisperer) Business and Developer for AI-powered coding productivity and automation.


**Machine Learning Frameworks and Pipelines:**


* In-depth knowledge of Amazon SageMaker, including Pipelines, Model Monitor, Data Wrangler, and SageMaker Clarify for bias detection and interpretability.
* Skilled in distributed model training with multi-GPU clusters and optimization for high-performance inference.


**Data Engineering and AI Workflow Optimization:**


* Proficient in building data pipelines with Amazon S3, AWS Glue, Lake Formation, and Redshift for AI and ML workloads.
* Experienced in optimizing data preparation for large-scale AI model training and inference workflows.


**AI Integration and Deployment:**


* Expertise in building end-to-end AI pipelines using AWS Lambda, Step Functions, and API Gateway for real-time AI inference and automation.
* Familiarity with containerized AI deployments using Amazon EKS and AWS Fargate.


**DevOps and MLOps Expertise:**


* Hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines for AI/ML workflows using AWS CodePipeline, CodeBuild, and SageMaker Pipelines.
* Proficiency in monitoring and maintaining AI systems with Amazon CloudWatch and SageMaker Model Monitor.


**AI Governance and Security:**


* Strong understanding of AI governance, incorporating IAM, AWS Key Management Service (KMS), and compliance frameworks.
* Knowledgeable in AI ethics, bias detection, and accountability using tools like SageMaker Clarify.


**Emerging AI Trends:**


* Up-to-date on Generative AI advancements such as RLHF (Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback), foundation model fine-tuning, and hybrid AI architectures.
* Familiarity with integrating open-source tools like Hugging Face Transformers and AWS-native solutions.


**Knowledge of Multi-Cloud AI Tools:**


* Good knowledge and understanding of Google Cloud AI tools such as Vertex AI, Cloud AutoML, and BigQuery ML, enabling effective integration in multi-cloud environments.


**Mentoring and Enablement Skills:**


* Proven ability to mentor team members and enable cross-functional collaboration to foster technical growth and innovation.
* Skilled in creating knowledge-sharing platforms and hands-on workshops to enhance team capabilities.


**Bonus Points**


* Passion for technology, with a demonstrated ability to quickly learn and stay up to date with industry trends.
* Data certification is a major advantage (e.g., Stanford, Coursera, Udacity, MIT, eCornell, or any Data certification with AWS/GCP).
* BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.


**Are you a Do'er?**



Be your truest self. Work on your terms. Make a difference.



We are home to a global team of incredible talent who work remotely and have the flexibility to have a schedule that balances your work and home life. We embrace and support leveling up your skills professionally and personally.



What does being a Do'er mean? We're all about being entrepreneurial, pursuing knowledge and having fun! Click here to learn more about our core values.



Sounds too good to be true? Check out our Glassdoor Page.



We thought so too, but we're here and happy we hit that 'apply' button.


* Unlimited Vacation
* Flexible Working Options
* Health Insurance
* Parental Leave
* Employee Stock Option Plan
* Home Office Allowance
* Professional Development Stipend
* Peer Recognition Program


**Many Do'ers, One Team**  

DoiT unites as *Many Do'ers, One Team*, where diversity is more than a goal—it's our strength. We actively cultivate an inclusive, equitable workplace, recognizing that each unique perspective enhances our innovation. By celebrating differences, we create an environment where every individual feels valued, contributing to our collective success.



#LI-Remote

title: Sektionschef DevOps Enablement
description:
*Drivs du av att se dina idéer bli verklighet? Välkommen till vår spännande och teknikintensiva värld.*  

  

Din roll


Som sektionschef för DevOps Enablement får du en nyckelroll i att etablera och utveckla en verksamhet som effektivt möter behoven av IT-stöd inom våra utvecklingsmiljöer. Du ansvarar för att ta fram och driva en långsiktig och hållbar strategi för hur TADS ska leverera optimala lösningar och tjänster både internt inom avdelningen och i nära samarbete med motsvarande organisationer inom BU Gripen, AN IT och Group IT.  

  

Du blir ansvarig för att bygga upp och leda en engagerad och kompetent grupp och säkerställa att vi tillsammans skapar moderna, skalbara och användarvänliga miljöer som stödjer utvecklingsprocesserna och affärsmålen.  

  

TADS har verksamhet både i Tannefors och Järfälla, och tjänsten kräver att du även tillbringar viss tid på plats i Järfälla.

  

Din profil


Vi söker dig som har gedigen erfarenhet av ledarskap inom IT och DevOps, gärna med bakgrund i att bygga upp och driva verksamheter eller team från grunden. Du har ett strategiskt och analytiskt arbetssätt och är van att samarbeta tvärfunktionellt med olika delar av en organisation.  

  

Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av att arbeta i större koncerner eller med komplexa verksamhetsmiljöer där du skapat samsyn och samverkan mellan olika affärsenheter. Du trivs med att driva förändring och att hitta innovativa lösningar som bidrar till verksamhetens framgång.  

  

*Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.*

  

Vad du blir en del av  

Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.


Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.


Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 25,500 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.


Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här.  



Vänligen observera att vi arbetar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum har gått ut.
company_description: Saab serves the global market with world-leading products, services and solutions from military defense to civil security.

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
**About Us****nShift** is the leading global provider of cloud delivery management solutions (SaaS), we enable the frictionless shipment and return of almost one billion shipments across 190 countries each year. We are headquartered in London and Oslo and have over 500 employees across offices in Sweden, Finland, Norway, Denmark, the United Kingdom, Poland, the Netherlands, Belgium, and Romania.
Our software is used by many of the world leading e-commerce, retail, manufacturing, and 3PL shippers due to us having over 1000 carriers integrated into our platform, nearly 3 times more than our competitors!  

If you buy goods online, there is a strong chance that nShift has powered that delivery, so come and join us as we shape the future of shipping, one frictionless journey at a time.**Purpose of Role**
Exciting and career-advancing opportunity for an analytical, critical thinking, and detail-oriented engineer to join a high-performing, happy and fun team at nShift!
Your main responsibility will be keeping all mission-critical infrastructure systems related to the nShift Delivery product up and running, with low maintenance efforts and at predictable costs.
At the moment the production nShift Delivery platform runs on servers owned by nShift and is hosted in a colocation data center in Gothenburg. Consequently, the hardware maintenance and the resolution of hardware issues on-site are part of the team's responsibility. The role also involves on-call support on a rotating basis.
One key initiative driven by the team is to migrate our infrastructure to AWS.
**The area of responsibility includes:**
Participate and contribute to our infrastructure migration project to AWS.
All team members share the same duties regarding the colocation datacenters' production systems and the non-production systems in AWS.
Configuration and maintenance of the hosted systems in close collaboration with the software engineers
Tuning systems and applications to cope with big data volumes and to be available 24/7
Monitoring of systems and applications
Automating deployments
Troubleshooting of incidents, scope of responsibility ends at the border between OS and application
Optimizing the current procedures and practices in the team
Being part of the on-call schedule outside office hours
**Required professional qualifications:**
Proven experience as a Site Reliability Engineer, DevOps, System Administrator, or similar role
Infrastructure, hardware and Linux based systems/applications management skills
Experience in managing an AWS environment, including automation.
Knowledge of managing network devices (firewall, switches, routers, etc) and security aspects.
Hands-on experience in implementing and improving automation/scripting for infrastructure, containers, systems and applications
Good working knowledge of most of these tools or technologies:
Ubuntu
git
Apache
Tomcat
LXC/LXD containers
Salt/SaltStack
PostgreSQL
Elastic Stack
Bonus points for extensive in-depth experience in any of the tools/technologies mentioned above
**Required personality traits and skill set**
Well-organized and positive attitude
Analytical-minded with problem-solving skillsTeam player with good collaboration and communication skills
Troubleshooting and learning from mistakes fan
Mindfulness of the implications of running a 24/7 operation
Fluent in writing and speaking in English
  

At nShift, we believe in embracing diversity in all forms and fostering an inclusive environment for everyone, which we believe is essential for our continued success. We're an equal opportunity employer, meaning all applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity, or disability status.

title: Microsoft Azure- och Integrationsspecialist till Pågen
description:
Välkommen till Pågen och vår härliga gemenskap där alla hjälper alla. Varje morgon levererar vi rykande färskt bröd från ugnen till våra konsumenter i Sverige och runtom i världen. Vi utökar nu vår IT-avdelning och söker därför dig, Microsoft Azure- och integrationsspecialist, som gillar en händelserik och utvecklande vardag och vill vara en del av vårt engagerade team.



Vad erbjuder vi dig?  

Vi välkomnar dig som har vilja och glöd, får saker att hända och kan utmana. Vi är stolta över de resultat vi uppnått men är måna om att utvecklas, är öppna för nya sätt att se på saker och vill alltid bli lite bättre - varje dag. Vi är små nog att fatta snabba beslut som krävs för att hitta nya vägar och nå resultat. Vi tror på kraften att göra förändringar tillsammans och hos oss har du möjlighet att göra skillnad.


Hos oss blir du en del av den viktiga svenska livsmedelsförsörjningen. Att leverera färskt bröd till landets butiker varje dag innebär en fartfylld och varierad vardag oavsett vad du arbetar med här på Pågen. Dagligen ställs vi inför nya utmaningar som vi löser tillsammans. Vi har bakat bröd sedan 1878, men resan har bara börjat. Nu tar vi steget in i framtiden för att bli Europas modernaste bageri. Och vi vill ha dig med på resan.



Om arbetet  

Är du en teknisk problemlösare med passion för molninfrastruktur och smarta integrationer? Vill du vara med och bygga framtidens IT-landskap där Microsoft Azure, Data Fabric och moderna integrationslösningar står i centrum? Då kan det här vara din nästa utmaning!  

I rollen som Microsoft Azure- och integrationsspecialist kommer du att ha ansvar för att:

* konfigurera, underhålla och optimera vår Microsoft Azure-miljö.
* säkerställa att infrastrukturen och uppsättningen i Azure är stabil, kostnadseffektiv och anpassad efter verksamhetens behov.
* förstå och tillämpa koncept inom Data Fabric för att möjliggöra effektiv dataintegration.
* stötta i arbete med integrationer mellan olika system – både molnbaserade och lokala – för att skapa en sömlös datahantering.


Vem är du?



Vi söker dig som har minst 5 års erfarenhet inom IT-infrastruktur, med särskilt fokus på Microsoft Azure och gärna integration. Där utöver har/är du:


* god förståelse på moderna DevOps-arbetssätt och vet hur man bygger smarta, säkra och skalbara lösningar i Azure.
* erfarenhet av systemintegration och API-utveckling.
* självgående, analytisk och har ett starkt driv att hitta rätt lösningar.


Du behärskar flera av följande:


* Djupgående kunskap och erfarenhet av Microsoft Azure.
* Stark teknisk kompetens inom infrastruktur och molntjänster.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Azure DevOps, EntraID och andra Azure-tjänster.
* Känner dig trygg med att utveckla inom: C#, Microsoft SQL databaser.
* Meriterande är om du har arbetat med någon av följande tekniker: Microsoft BizTalk, API-utveckling eller Frends.
* Du har stor vana vid att använda bilder och diagram både som dokumentation och som underlag för diskussion omkring lösningsdesign.


Vi lägger stor vikt vid din personlighet där det är viktigt att du är lösningsorienterad, social och kommunikativ. Du har lätt för att lära nytt och trivs i en roll där du har många kontaktytor. Vidare har du driv, är självgående och bekväm med att ta egna initiativ. Och att du har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.



På Pågen är du med där det händer! Vi arbetar tillsammans på kontoret varje dag eftersom det underlättar samarbete i vår händelserika vardag där alla har en viktig roll. Rollen som Microsoft Azure- och Integrationsspecialist är placerad på huvudkontoret i Malmö och resor till vårt bageri i Göteborg ingår i tjänsten.



Sök tjänsten  

Varmt välkommen med din an med sista ningsdag 250629 men redan idag då vi hanterar ningar löpande. För mer information om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta IT-chef Infrastruktur, Mickael Kroon antingen via mejl på mickael.kroon@pagen.se eller på telefon 040-323855.

title: Enterprise Solutions Architect
description:
DESCRIPTION


Are you passionate about cloud technology and helping customers innovate?  

Join our AWS Solutions Architecture team in Stockholm and empower enterprises across industries to innovate at speed and scale with cloud technologies.  

  

As a Solutions Architect at AWS, you’ll build technical relationships with customers of all sizes and operate as their trusted advisor, ensuring they get the most out of the cloud at every stage of their journey.  

  

You’ll manage the overall technical relationship between AWS and our customers, making recommendations on security, cost, performance, reliability and operational efficiency to accelerate their challenging, mission-critical projects.  

  

Internally, you will be the voice of the customer, sharing their needs and wants to inform the roadmap of AWS features.  

In this role, your creativity will link technology to tangible solutions, with the opportunity to define cloud-native reference architectures for a variety of use cases.  

  

You will participate in the creation and sharing of best practices, technical content and new reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts) and evangelize and educate about AWS technology (e.g. through workshops, user groups, meetups, public speaking, online videos or conferences).  

This role is within the Europe North organization (Sweden) and you would be working with Enterprise customers.  

  

If you can educate AWS customers about the art of the possible, while challenging the impossible... come build the future with us!  

  

AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector.  

  

A day in the life  

Diverse Experiences  

AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.  

  

Why AWS?  

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.  

  

Inclusive Team Culture  

Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.  

  

Mentorship & Career Growth  

We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.  

  

Work/Life Balance  

We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.  

Represent your region vis-à-vis AWS product teams and influence our GenAI & AI/ML roadmap to best support your customers.  

Work with account teams, AWS specialists (solution architects, data scientists) and partners to deliver results for your customers.  

  

About the team  

The Specialists Organization, within Amazon Global Sales Organization (AGS), positions AWS as the leading platform for GenAI and AI/ML workloads. We enable customers to become data-driven organizations and scale their AI capabilities. Working backwards from customer needs, we execute go-to-market plans as specialist sales and with our solution architect teams. As an AGS team member, you'll guide customers throughout their AWS journey, from new service ideation to accelerating adoption of established solutions. We think big, deliver exceptional results, and collaborate across AWS as #OneTeam.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

* Background in any of the following: Cloud Architecture, Systems Design, Software Development, Infrastructure Architecture, Data Engineering or DevOps
* Technical Degree (Computer Science, Maths, Engineering or equivalent) and/or relevant tech experience.
* Fluent written and verbal communication skills in English
* A passion for technology and for learning

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

* Experience designing, building, refactoring or operating large scale and impactful IT systems - either on premises or in the cloud
* Working knowledge of cloud native architectures
* Knowledge of a modern programming language (Python, JavaScript, Go, .Net, Java, etc.) and/or scripting, Infrastructure as Code etc.
* In-depth working knowledge in a technology domain such as distributed internet-scale web or mobile applications, DevOps, Serverless, Big Data, Analytics, Machine Learning, enterprise workloads (SAP, VMware, Windows etc.), high-performance databases (SQL and/or NoSQL), complex networking implementations, highly secured workloads etc.
* Experience working in a customer-facing role or a role which involved public speaking
* AWS certification (e.g. AWS Solutions Architect Associate or Professional) or other industry certification
* Fluent written and verbal communication skills in Swedish

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Are you a problem-solver who thrives on improving systems, streamlining workflows, and building reliable infrastructure? We’re looking for a skilled DevOps Engineer to help shape the foundation of our platform. At Visit Group, you'll be part of a curious and collaborative team solving real-world problems for thousands of users in the travel and tourism industry.  

  



If you're excited about building the backbone that powers seamless deployments and scalable platforms and want to work where experimentation is encouraged and success is shared, you’ll feel right at home.


**Key Responsibilities**  

As a DevOps Engineer, you’ll play a vital role in modernizing our platform infrastructure, accelerating developer workflows, and enhancing service reliability. You will:


* Design, maintain, and scale our hybrid cloud infrastructure (public/private).
* Champion Infrastructure as Code and CI/CD using tools like Ansible and Terraform.
* Operate and improve Kubernetes clusters for workload orchestration and scalability.
* Build tools and frameworks to boost developer productivity and enable self-service deployments.
* Collaborate closely with development teams to automate provisioning, configuration, and deployments.

Contribute to disaster recovery planning and high availability strategies.  

* 

  

**Your Profile**

* 5+ years of experience
* Experience working with Kubernetes for orchestration and scalability
* Experience managing both Windows and Linux environments
* Experience with virtualization technologies (e.g., VMware, Hyper-V)
* Experience working with cloud technologies (Azure, AWS)
* Experience with IaC (e.g Terraform)
* Automation using Python, Bash, or PowerShell.
* Experience working with networking, DNS, AD, certificates, and security best practices.
* Experience working with both relational and non-relational databases, including SQL Server and MongoDB
* Experience working with observability and monitoring (Grafana, Prometheus or similar).
* Knowledge about message brokers (e.g., RabbitMQ, ServiceBus) would be advantageous
* Are passionate about DevOps culture, automation, and making life easier for developers.

Enjoy knowledge sharing, experimenting, and learning by doing.  

* 

  

**Why Visit Group?**  

At Visit Group, we value a unique blend of professionalism, personality, and passion. We seek individuals who bring self-confidence, problem-solving skills, and an interest in sustainable development practices. Our office culture emphasizes collaboration, learning, and creating enjoyable experiences for our team and our clients.


Interested? - We’d love to hear from you! Apply now and let’s build the future of payment technology together.


**About Visit Group**  

Visit Group is a leading European software provider specializing in technology solutions for the tourism industry. Founded in 1999 and headquartered in Gothenburg, Sweden, the company has grown to become a leader in the travel technology sector. We offer a comprehensive digital ecosystem that includes property management systems, booking systems, ticketing and e-commerce platforms, and travel switches for various segments of the tourism industry. Our product portfolio includes Citybreak, BookVisit, iTicket, VisBook, and WebX.


With over 20 years of experience, we serve more than 3,000 customers across 25 countries, including tourism organizations, accommodations, tours, and activity vendors worldwide. Our solutions enable inbound tourism businesses, such as hotels, ski resorts, tour operators, and destination marketing companies, to sell, combine, and distribute tourism products sourced from hundreds of external inventory platforms.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
*Vill du vara med och forma framtidens smarta IT-lösningar? Som DevOps Engineer hos Advania får du en central roll i att bygga automatiserade, säkra och effektiva system som skapar hållbara värden för våra kunder. Tillsammans med engagerade kollegor utvecklar du lösningar som gör skillnad — från kod till produktion. Hos oss får du arbeta i en inkluderande miljö där kunskapsdelning och innovation står i fokus.*

**DevOps Engineer på Advania**
------------------------------

Vi söker dig som har ett genuint intresse för teknik och som trivs med att arbeta i team där kunskap delas och där utveckling och drift går hand i hand. För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du är problemlösande och proaktiv, med en god samarbets- och kommunikationsförmåga. Du är också strukturerad, kvalitetsmedveten och ansvarstagande, och du har en naturlig nyfikenhet och vilja att hålla dig uppdaterad på ny teknik.


Du kommer bland annat att:

* Designa, implementera och underhålla CI/CD-pipelines för automatiserad testning, bygg och distribution.
* Säkerställa drift, övervakning och tillgänglighet av applikationer och infrastruktur i moln- och/eller on-prem-miljöer.
* Arbeta nära utvecklingsteam och systemadministratörer för att optimera samarbetet mellan utveckling och drift.
* Implementera Infrastructure as Code (IaC) med exempelvis Terraform, Bicep eller CloudFormation.
* Delta i säkerhetsgranskningar, logghantering, prestandaoptimering och incidenthantering.
* Administrera och hantera vår interna utvecklingsorganisation i DevOps.
* Medverka i leveranser gällande design och uppsättning av infrastruktur.
  

  

Rollen är baserad i Kristianstad.

**Vad vi söker hos dig**
------------------------

Vi söker dig som har ett genuint intresse för teknik och som trivs med att arbeta i team där kunskap delas och där utveckling och drift går hand i hand. För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du är problemlösande och proaktiv, med en god samarbets- och kommunikationsförmåga. Du är också strukturerad, kvalitetsmedveten och ansvarstagande, och du har en naturlig nyfikenhet och vilja att hålla dig uppdaterad på ny teknik.  

  

Vi ser gärna att du har:

  

* Fler års arbetslivserfarenhet av DevOps eller systemutveckling/systemadministration i komplexa IT-miljöer.
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD-verktyg (t.ex. GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Azure DevOps, Jenkins).
* Erfarenhet av molnplattformar (Azure, AWS eller Google Cloud).
* Erfarenhet av Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, ARM, Pulumi).
* Erfarenhet i skriptspråk (Bash, PowerShell, Python eller liknande).
* Erfarenhet av versionshantering med Azure DevOps och Git.
* Erfarenhet av övervakning och loggning (t.ex. Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, Datadog).
* Erfarenhet av release management och testautomatisering.

### **Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**

Visa gärna ditt intresse så snart som möjligt då vi intervjuar löpande. Vi välkomnar sökanden med olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter och synsätt, eftersom vi vet att en bredare mångfald berikar var och en av oss och stärker såväl effektivitet som kreativitet i vårt arbete.


Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en obligatorisk bakgrundskontroll, en för oss kvalitativ kontroll inför ett anställningsbeslut. Advania samarbetar även med Ljung & Sjöberg för en proaktiv arbetsplats kopplat till alkohol och droger.


Tveka inte att höra av dig om du har några frågor eller funderingar.
company_description: Advania är ett techbolag som utformar skräddarsydda lösningar och skapar hållbara värden genom smart användning av teknik.

title: Erfaren Azure-arkitekt
description:
Vill du vara en del av ett modigt och transparent team som med ett nordiskt tankesätt levererar innovativa lösningar till våra kunder? Är du en nyfiken och drivande Azure-entusiast som är intresserad av att jobba som rådgivande specialistkonsult och optimera cloudlösningar? Varmt välkommen att hänga med på vår framgångsresa och fortsätta att bygga vårt clouderbjudande på Knowit!

**Vad du kommer att göra:**


I ditt dagliga arbete kommer du främst att designa, planera och implementera cloudarkitektur i Microsoft Azure samt arbeta nära kunder med pre-sales, workshops och optimering av teknik- och affärsprocesser.


Vårt mål är att erbjuda expertrådgivning för förbättrad användarupplevelse, prestanda, kostnadseffektivitet och hållbarhet. Vi värdesätter nyfikenhet och innovation i takt med den tekniska utvecklingen.


Som konsult på Knowit får du arbeta med varierande uppdrag, både in-house och on-site, inom olika branscher inom Norden. Microsoft har utsett oss till en ledande partner för cloudsatsningar inom offentlig sektor i Sverige.

**Vem är du?**


Din it-bakgrund kan vara varierande, men i dagsläget identifierar du dig som en sann Azure-specialist med intresse för design, arkitektur, utveckling och optimering av moderna lösningar och applikationer. Du behöver ha:


Bred kunskap inom Microsoft Azure med minst 5 års erfarenhet som arkitekt


Serverless utveckling


Utveckling av microservice-lösningar


Utveckling av ”Infrastructure as Code” med tekniker som Azure Bicep och Terraform.


Bekant med Linux, CI/CD-pipelines, Docker och Kubernetes eller andra containertekniker.


Byggverktyg som Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions eller andra liknande verktyg.


Då våra kunder och kollegor pratar både svenska och engelska, behöver du behärska båda språken i såväl tal som skrift.


Vi är övertygade om att AI inte bara förändrar hur vi löser tekniska problem, utan också hur vi samarbetar, kommunicerar och skapar värde. Därför söker vi dig som redan har testat, eller vill utforska, hur AI kan bidra till smartare arbetssätt och bättre resultat – både för oss själva och våra kunder.

**Meriterande**


Du får mer än gärna ha erfarenhet av mjukvaruprojekt och du har påbörjat din certifieringsresa – med ambitionen att fortsätta så. Specifikt intresse för it-säkerhet tas emot med öppna armar. Har du skaffat dig äkta AI-erfarenheter att applicera i ditt arbete är detta en fin bonus.

**Om Knowit**


Hos oss på Knowit får du möjlighet att skratta, prova nya idéer, växa som person och dela din kunskap både internt och med våra kunder. Vi hjälper och inspirerar varandra i det dagliga arbete, där utbildning och certifieringar inom den senaste Cloud och DevOps teknologin är en nyckelfaktor för vår framgång. Detta inte minst genom våra oberoende partnerskap på högsta nivå med samtliga ”big three” Azure, AWS och GCP samt lokala partnerskap med t ex Hashicorp/Terraform.

**Ansökan**


Vi använder analyser i rekryteringsprocessen för att säkerställa en rättvis bedömning av dig som kandidat och ha ett kompetensbaserat urval. Vi arbetar med löpande urval, så varmt välkommen att söka tjänsten redan idag!


Har du frågor om tjänsten? Välkommen att kontakta Natalie Permerup (rekryterare) natalie.permerup@knowit.se.

title: Senior projekt-/programledare
description:
**Uppdrag:** Senior projekt-/programledare – införande av centralt verksamhetsstöd

**Beskrivning:**  

En större offentlig organisation söker en erfaren projekt- eller programledare för att driva ett omfattande införande av ett centralt verksamhetssystem. Uppdraget kombinerar teknisk implementering med ett starkt fokus på förändringsledning och verksamhetsförankring. Rollen innebär övergripande ansvar för planering, styrning och koordinering av aktiviteter i nära samverkan med både interna funktioner och externa aktörer. Du leder ett etablerat team som inkluderar resurser för förändringsledning, delprojektledning och administrativt stöd. Rapportering sker löpande till uppdragsgivare och styrgrupp.

**Kravprofil:**

* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att driva införandeprojekt av affärskritiska IT-stöd eller motsvarande lösningar
* Förmåga att hantera dialoger med leverantörer och koordinera flera intressenter samtidigt
* Stark kommunikativ förmåga – både skriftligt och muntligt – i kontakt med olika målgrupper
* Välutvecklad struktur- och planeringsförmåga samt vana att stödja beslutsprocesser
* Minst 12 års erfarenhet av att leda komplexa förändringsprojekt inom större organisationer
* Självgående ledarstil med förmåga att driva arbetet framåt, fatta beslut och prioritera
* Djup förståelse för hur förändring påverkar organisationer samt förmåga att skapa engagemang och hantera motstånd
* Minst 8 års erfarenhet av arbete inom offentlig verksamhet

**Meriterande erfarenheter:**

* Vana att arbeta i verktyg som Azure DevOps
* Utbildning inom organisationsutveckling, förändringsledning eller projekt-/programstyrning
* Kunskap om regelverk inom informationssäkerhet och dataskydd, såsom GDPR, NIS 2 eller motsvarande


Alla angivna krav ska kunna styrkas med referenser eller relevant dokumentation.

 **Om Rasulson Consulting**

Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: Senior Specialist-Engineering Environment Architecture
description:
Stockholm,Stockholm,Sweden
Job ID**764620**
Join our Team
**About the Role**

  

As our Senior Specialist – EE Architecture, you'll be a key enabler to deliver faster, smarter, and higher-quality software within CCI. You’ll lead the transformation of a complex, high-performance CI/CD environment into a cloud-agnostic, scalable ecosystem that leverages the best of open source, AI/ML, and DevSecOps.

  

This is a strategic technical leadership role with a global impact. You will set the direction for tooling, architecture, and workflows that support the entire RAN Software and Compute (RCE) organization — enabling seamless integration, fast feedback loops, and secure deployments at scale.

  

TEE (Test & Engineering Environment) is a core part of CCI PEU (Cloud Compute Infrastructure) , which is now embedded within the newly restructured RCE (RAN SW & Compute Platform Engineering) unit at Ericsson. Together, we form the foundation that powers world-class RAN development, integration, and deployment capabilities on a global scale.  

Are you ready to architect the systems that shape the future of mobile networks? At Ericsson, we’re building the most advanced Radio Access Network (RAN) solutions — and at the heart of that innovation is our Engineering Environment (EE). We’re looking for a visionary technical leader to help us revolutionize our continuous integration and delivery systems and take our cloud-native journey to the next level.

 **What you will do:**

* Own and drive the evolution of the Engineering Environment (EE) Architecture, in alignment with Ericsson’s One RAN strategy
* Transform legacy infrastructure into a cloud-native CI/CD ecosystem using Docker, Kubernetes, and OpenShift
* Introduce AI/ML to enable intelligent automation, fault prediction, and continuous quality improvement
* Lead the charge on DevSecOps, embedding security practices directly into the CI/CD pipelines
* Collaborate across teams and initiatives such as ESP Evolution, and unite module CI pipelines under a consistent and flexible architecture
* Guide and mentor CI developers, promote best practices, and foster cross-team consensus on technical solutions
* Keep Ericsson at the forefront of innovation by tracking open-source trends, proposing patents, and continuously sharing knowledge
* Conduct architecture reviews, shape the technical roadmap, and enable a culture of learning through coaching and technical talks
 **Skills You Bring:**

* Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Communication Systems or related fields
* Proven expertise in CI/CD architecture and engineering environments at scale
* Hands-on experience with containerization and orchestration tools (Kubernetes, Docker, Helm)
* Experience in security integration within CI pipelines and modern DevOps/DevSecOps practices
* Applied experience with AI/ML for software pipeline optimization
* Ability to lead, mentor, and align cross-functional teams in complex technical environments
* Strategic mindset and architectural review skills
* A strong passion for continuous innovation, knowledge sharing, and technical leadership
* Active interest in industry developments and contributions to open-source or patent initiatives
  

Apply today and be the driving force behind our world-class EE architecture.

 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**

title: Devops Engineer
description:
**Doktor.se** 
 is looking for a Devops Engineer to join our exciting growth journey. Our mission is to provide a platform to make digital and physical healthcare accessible and easier for everyone. We are creating a platform of services, tools, and processes to make it possible. We believe this mission is challenging but extremely exciting and fulfilling. We seek additional engineers to strengthen our “Platform Enablement” team!
   

  

**As a Devops Engineer, you'll enjoy**
 You will work with our infrastructure, monitoring, deployment tools, and services for a secure, reliable, and highly available platform. Also, you develop automation toolings and preassembled configurations to make a better developer experience. You take the initiative and drive to evolve the platform's infrastructure to support our rapid business growth and compliance needs. You will collaborate on building a microservice-based system running on Kubernetes in AWS (Amazon Web Services). You will improve deployment automation following the principles for Infrastructure as Code and enhance platform monitoring and alerting to scale the platform. Like always, constant solidifying our security posture is job zero.
   

  

 You will work with our tech stack, including but not limited to Terraform, Typescript, Python, Datadog, AWS, PostgreSQL, Kubernetes/EKS, Flux/GitOps, GitHub Actions.
   

  

**Qualifications And Personal Qualities**
* Curiosity, being analytical with a passion for problem-solving, and being a good communicator
* hands-on experience with Kubernetes and building CI/CD pipelines
* hands-on experience with AWS
* hands-on experience with Terraform
* hands-on experience with the JavaScript ecosystem
* We are an international organization, so fluency in English is required


**We offer you**
 With us, you get a workplace to grow, phenomenal colleagues, and the opportunity to be part of a growing healthcare group with many points of contact. Together, we create a delightful team spirit, a strong sense of community, and a robust culture!
   

  

 We also offer you:
   

  

* Collective agreement
* Occupational pension
* Wellness allowance
* Breakfast every Monday


**More practical details**
* The desired start is as soon as possible, but of course, we take into consideration your notice period and preferences
* The position is a permanent employment with an initial probationary period
* Your placement will be at Sveavägen 63, with the possibility to work from home Fridays


 If this describes you, then you know what to do! We look forward to receiving your application.
   

  

**Good luck!**
 På Doktor.Se vill vi göra saker annorlunda. Vi vill utmana och förändra en hel bransch. Allt började med en idé om att det måste gå att skapa en vårdlösning som är bättre anpassad till vår tid och våra behov. Att det måste gå att få moderna digitala verktyg och traditionell fysisk vård att samverka med utgångspunkt i patientens behov. Och att göra det så att det inte bara blir tillgängligt för våra patienter utan också bidrar till att utveckla det sätt som vård erbjuds på idag. För oss alla. Det här är faktiskt vad vi gör idag. Men vi är långt ifrån klara och är ute på en spännande förändringsresa. Där kan du få vara med och bidra.

title: Senior DevOps
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av Linux som utvecklings- och driftmiljö
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av versionshantering i Git eller motsvarande
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av Docker eller Podman
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av GitOps
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av konfiguration av applikationer för deployment i Kubernetes/Openshift
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av arbete i agila team
* Skriva och tala svenska flytande


**Meriterande**
* Minst 1 års erfarenhet av Kustomize / Helm
* Minst 1 års erfarenhet av Istio / Service Mesh
* Minst 1 års erfarenhet av administration av GitLab
* Minst 1 års erfarenhet av PKI-hantering
* Minst 1 års erfarenhet av administration av Nexus
* Minst 1 års erfarenhet av administration av PostgreSQL
* Minst 1 års erfarenhet av Terraform


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 18-06-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: AWS Cloud Engineer
description:
**☁️ We're Looking for a Cloud Engineer Who Knows AWS Like Home** 




 At VetFamily, we’re scaling a portfolio of products that serve veterinary clinics and suppliers across the globe. Behind every feature, every visualization, and every insight we deliver is a modern, cloud-native infrastructure. We're now looking for a
 **AWS Cloud Engineer** 
 who can help us build, operate, and evolve that backbone—ensuring reliability, performance, and agility across our AWS-based ecosystem.
 



 Whether you're coming from a DevOps background or grew into cloud engineering from fullstack development, this role is for someone who’s deeply fluent in modern AWS services and comfortable working across a broad platform footprint—from web services and data warehouses to alarms, pipelines, and permissions.
 



 This is a role for a hands-on builder and infrastructure thinker. You’ll help us maintain and expand our cloud architecture, harmonize environments across teams, and support the rollout of new products, integrate M&A targets and future in-house initiatives.
 



  





  





**🌐 About the Role** 




 VetFamily operates a diverse but unified platform, comprising half a dozen core products—all harmonized on AWS. These span transaction engines, data pipelines, internal tools, and customer-facing portals used by clinics and suppliers.
 



 As we expand our development pipeline and product portfolio, we need someone who can take ownership of our cloud infrastructure and support our cross-functional teams with cloud development and best practices. You'll be an advocate for reliability, security, and simplicity—making sure our systems scale with our business.
 



 You won’t be devops—you’ll be architecting, developing, improving, and coaching others in how to operate within our AWS environment with confidence and clarity.
 



  





  





**🔧 What You’ll Do** 



* **AWS Infrastructure** 
 – Build and maintain infrastructure across a modern AWS stack.
* **Cloud Development** 
 – build fullstack products together with our product owners and tech team.
* **Infrastructure-as-Code** 
 – Manage environments with Terraform.
* **DevOps & Monitoring** 
 – Set up and maintain CI/CD pipelines, logging, metrics.
* **Backend Operations** 
 – Support the operation of backend services for our customer-facing products and internal systems.
* **Cross-Product Consistency** 
 – Harmonize infrastructure practices across our product portfolio.
* **Cloud Coaching** 
 – Help developers and data teams work more effectively in AWS by promoting best practices and self-service tooling.
* **Product Enablement** 
 – Work closely with product teams to support the deployment and scaling of new features and services.



  





  





**🧠 About You** 



* Strong hands-on experience with AWS, Terraform and cloud hosting best-practices for multi region/country deloyments.
* Able to support a broad platform: you’re familiar with how modern web services, DWHs (like Snowflake), and data pipelines interact in a cloud-native world.
* Proactive mindset—you look for opportunities to improve stability, performance, and developer experience before problems arise.
* Strong debugging and incident response skills—you know how to set the right alerts and act when something’s off.
* Excellent communication skills—you can guide a team through AWS trade-offs or explain why a service should be throttled.



  
 



  





  





**🌟 Why Join VetFamily?** 



* **Cloud at Scale** 
 – Operate and evolve a platform that processes billions in transactions and serves a global network of veterinary clinics.
* **Hands-On Ownership** 
 – No red tape, no silos—you’ll own your work and make real decisions.
* **Tech-Driven Culture** 
 – Work with developers, data scientists, and product teams who value clarity, automation, and clean architecture.
* **Growth & Exploration** 
 – Be part of a scaling team where your skills can grow alongside our product ambitions.
* **Stockholm Office, Global Reach** 
 – Enjoy a great office environment with hybrid flexibility.
* **Mission-Driven Work** 
 – Help support the care of animals worldwide by enabling better digital tools for veterinarians.



  





  





 📨
 **Apply now to help us build a more scalable, reliable, and cloud-native platform for veterinary care.**

title: Data Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**Job Title: Senior Data Infrastructure Engineer / DevOps Consultant** 




  





**📍 Location: Hybrid – Stockholm, Sweden** 




**🕒 Start Date: ASAP (subject to 4-week background check)** 




**💼 Experience Level: Senior (5+ years)** 




**Notice Period: Immediate Joining preferred** 




**📅 Interview Process:** 



* **Single technical interview (~90 minutes)**
* **May include a scratch pad-style demonstration (no live coding)**



  





  





**Role Overview:** 





 We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer / DevOps Consultant to join a fast-paced project focused on building, optimizing, and maintaining robust data infrastructure. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in data pipeline development, orchestration, and infrastructure as code (IaC), with a DevOps-driven mindset.
 




  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Design, build, and maintain end-to-end data pipelines
* Orchestrate workflows using Airflow
* Build infrastructure using Terraform or Terragrunt
* Deploy and manage systems in Kubernetes environments
* Collaborate on CI/CD pipelines and ensure infrastructure reliability
* Perform quality checks and troubleshooting on pipeline/infrastructure setups
* Mix of greenfield and optimization work on existing data systems



  





**Must-Have Technical Skills:** 



* Python – strong proficiency
* Airflow – essential for orchestration
* Terraform/Terragrunt – Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
* Kubernetes – deployment and container orchestration
* Experience with AWS and/or GCP



  





**Preferred Skills:** 



* Java – a plus
* Experience with Apache Spark or AWS Glue



**Ideal Candidate:** 



* 5+ years of relevant experience in data engineering and/or DevOps
* Comfortable working independently with minimal supervision
* Strong problem-solving mindset and attention to deployment quality
* Available to start as soon as background checks are cleared (approx. 4 weeks)



  





**Interested candidates can directly apply or share their resume at kiran.sawlani@owision.com** 




  





  





**Warm regards,** 




**Kiran Sawlani** 




**Sr. Talent Acquisition Lead** 




**Owision AB**

title: Platform Engineer - Office Systems & Tools
description:
*Global migration is a 21st-century reality. Whether people are fleeing from something or racing towards better opportunity, following love or seeking new experiences, more and more are living in different environments and in new ways. We celebrate the power of people coming together. That’s why we connect ambitious people abroad with their families and friends back home so they can support each other emotionally and financially, and lead more enriched lives.*
*Our ambitious team reflects our international audience. We are a diverse group of people from all over the world that come together every day—and we’re looking for others driven by the same desire to create meaningful products that bridge cultural and geographic distances.*
**The Role**
 At Rebtel, we are on a mission to break down communication barriers and connect people worldwide. As a leading technology-driven telecommunications company, we offer innovative solutions that empower global communities. Our team thrives on collaboration, diversity, and a fast-paced, entrepreneurial spirit.
   

  

 We are looking for a proactive and hands-on platform engineer to ensure our team has the tools, support, and infrastructure needed to work efficiently and securely. If you are passionate about IT operations, end-user support, and automation, this is a great opportunity to contribute to a growing tech company with an international team.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
 End-User Support & IT Operations
   

  

* Act as the primary point of contact for IT support across Rebtel’s offices, assisting employees both onsite (Stockholm HQ) and remotely.
* Manage onboarding and offboarding of employees, including account setup, device provisioning, and access management.
* Troubleshoot and resolve hardware, software, and connectivity issues for macOS, Windows, and Linux users.
* Ensure seamless operation of conference rooms, video conferencing, and office IT infrastructure.
* Maintain and support Rebtel’s corporate applications, including Google Workspace, Slack, Atlassian, and other SaaS tools.


 IT Infrastructure & Security
   

  

* Monitor and maintain office IT infrastructure, including Wi-Fi, VPNs, network security, and firewalls.
* Implement and enforce IT security policies, including device encryption, access control, and endpoint security solutions.
* Assist with software deployments, system updates, and IT automation projects.
* Maintain identity and access management through tools like Google Workspace, Okta, or Azure AD.


 Process Optimization & Automation
   

  

* Identify opportunities to automate repetitive IT tasks using scripting (e.g., Bash, PowerShell, Python).
* Maintain and improve IT documentation, including troubleshooting guides and IT policies.
* Work closely with DevOps and Engineering teams to enhance internal IT infrastructure.


**What We’re Looking For**
* 3+ years of experience in IT support, system administration, or IT operations.
* Strong troubleshooting skills in macOS, Windows, and Linux environments.
* Experience managing cloud-based IT environments (Google Workspace, Microsoft 365, or similar).
* Good understanding of networking fundamentals (Wi-Fi, VPN, TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP).
* Hands-on experience with IT security best practices and endpoint management tools.
* Familiarity with MDM solutions (Jamf, Intune, or similar) is a plus.
* Experience working with automation and scripting (PowerShell, Bash, Python) is a plus.
* Previous experience in a fast-growing tech company/startup environment is a bonus.


**Why Join Rebtel?**
* Be part of an innovative, diverse, and tech-driven company with a global impact.
* Work in a modern and flexible office environment in Stockholm.
* Opportunity to work on cutting-edge IT projects and automation initiatives.
* Competitive salary, benefits, and professional growth opportunities.


 Some of the Benefits
   

  

* Comprehensive Pension Plan
* Health Checkups and Private Medical Insurance
* 10k Bucket (net) for wellness allowance and travel (benefit taxed)
* Discount on gym memberships
* Bonus program
* Parental leave pay
* 30 days of annual vacation
* Relocation support for a smooth transition if you're joining us from afar
* A modern office in central Stockholm


 Rebtel is an international workplace and at the office we speak English, therefore high English proficiency is required.
   

  

*We are Rebtel. We come from all around the world, to create products for anyone who has crossed a border. We believe in equal opportunity and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.*
 Global migration is a 21st-century reality. Whether people are fleeing from something or racing towards better opportunity, following love or seeking new experiences, more and more are living in different environments and in new ways. We celebrate the power of people coming together. That’s why we connect ambitious people abroad with their families and friends back home so they can support each other emotionally and financially, and lead more enriched lives.
   

  

 Our ambitious team reflects our international audience. We are a diverse group of people from all over the world that come together every day—and we’re looking for others driven by the same desire to create meaningful products that bridge cultural and geographic distances.

title: Senior/ Lead Data Engineer
description:
**About the role** 




  





 We’re now looking for a Lead/Senior Data Engineer to strengthen our team who is interested in working with state-of-the-art data technologies and frameworks, enabling informed decision-making and having a big impact on your everyday work. As our customers are growing internationally the amount of data will also grow even more and you will be an integral part of a company set out to make our customers more data-driven.
 



  
 



**Role type :** 
 Permanent / Contract
 



  





**What you'll be doing** 




  





 ·      Developing and optimizing data pipelines, data collection, ETL processes and data warehouse.
 



 ·      Work closely with product owner, analysts, data specialists, and stakeholders across the business, to build solutions and data sets to enable new insights and help them discover new opportunities.
 



 ·      Scaling new systems and platforms as we grow to enable data as a product.
 



 ·      Take ownership and responsibility of your day today deliverables.
 



 ·      Being an integral part of enabling insights to our customers and users.
 



 ·      Use state-of-the-art data processing frameworks, technologies and platforms to help the team achieve success.
 



 ·      Play around data services using major cloud providers.
 



 ·      Work with different market-leading customers.
 



  
 



  





**You should have** 




  





 ·      At least 5+ years of experience in data engineering services, data management, programming and advanced analytics environments, including building data platforms on on-premise and cloud.
 



 ·      Designing and developing data transformation pipelines using standard tools like Azure Data Factory, DBT & Abinitio.
 



 . Code advanced data processing solutions within Azure Databricks (Lakehouse)
 



 ·      Proficiency in Python, bash and SQL, and experience in a range of data management technologies, such as No-SQL and distributed systems. Knowledge of Java or Scala is a plus.
 



 ·      Experience with designing and architecting cloud-based data solutions (Azure, AWS or GCP)
 



 ·      Solid software architecture skills, keen to leverage patterns to write code that is resilient, scalable , and maintainable.
 



  ·      Working close with Business Analysts and Data Analysts to understand the requirements for the end product and suggest optimal data models back-end/front-end for optimal performance
 



 ·      Collaborating with platform teams, data engineers in core systems as well as data scientists for advanced analytics use cases.
 



  





**Good to have Microsoft specific cloud services** 




  





 ·      Designing and developing data transformation pipelines using standard tools like Azure Data Factory
 



 ·      Conceptualizing and implementing solutions within ADLS, Azure Synapse, Azure SQL and Azure Data Lake
 



 ·      Development/code management using Azure DevOps
 



  





  
 



**What we offer (based on the type of role)** 









 We offer you a good possibility for your professional growth in a challenging role. With us, you will have a good opportunity to directly influence your career development. We believe that trust fosters freedom and creativity. Our culture is built on transparency and active sharing. We provide you the opportunity to work with different projects and technologies to grow your career.
 



  





 We provide space and expenses to learn and get certified in desired technologies which give value to your role.
 



  










**How to apply** 




  
 



  Please apply directly here, or share your details along with your updated CV to info@databees.ai
 



  





 We are looking forward to talking to you if you are interested in this position!

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
We're looking for a
 **Data Engineer** 
 who has fully embraced the
 **AI-driven development workflow** 
 .
 



 We believe in a future where engineers use their reasoning skills, architectural mindset, and attention to detail to guide AI-powered tools in generating code. This approach significantly increases development velocity—but your name is still on the commit. That means you’ll need a holistic, thoughtful, and defensive mindset to review AI-generated code, make sound architectural decisions, and ensure quality throughout.
 



 This way of working places less emphasis on your specific software language background. That said, our codebase primarily uses Python and Snowflake, and we plan to continue down that path.
 



  





 In this role, you'll be instrumental in modernizing our core product—a platform that handles billions in transactions annually and supports veterinary clinics across EMEA, the US, and Australia.
 



 We're now focused on scaling and modernizing this product: reducing technical debt, unifying the architecture and deployment processes, and continuously delivering new features to empower our customers and partners.
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 



* **Data Pipeline Development** 
 – Build and maintain scalable ETL services consuming xls, originally developed in
 **Python** 
 . Currently deployed on
 **AWS** 
 and targeting a
 **postgreSQL** 
 database.
* **AI code flow** 
 - continue rolling out modern tools and ways-of-working to help the team increase velocity.
* **System Architecture** 
 – Contribute to system design and architecture to support growth and modernization.
* **Business-Critical Development** 
 – Build features that help suppliers, clinics, and VetFamily manage
 **contracts, transactions, and product recommendations** 
 .
* **Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams** 
 – Work alongside
 **tech leads, full-stack developers, data scientists, and product owners** 
 in Sweden and France.



  





**About You, We are looking for:** 



* Experience in Ai powered development: embraced chatGPT and later transitioned to cody/cursor/copilot.
* Python (Django preferred) and Java.
* Experience in system architecture and software design.
* Ability to work in a complex product environment.
* Strong communication skills and business understanding – You ask the right questions, understand revenue models, and see the big picture.
* Experience with maintainable DevOps and AWS.
* Passion for animals, veterinary technology, or pet-related industries.
* A social person who want to work with coworkers in our office in stockholm.
* Interest in working in a diverse and inclusive environment.



  





  





**Why Join Us?** 




 🌍
 **Scale-Up Company with Global Presence** 
 – Be part of a forward-thinking company dedicated to improving veterinary care worldwide.
 



 🚀
 **Impact & Growth** 
 – Work on a high-impact product that supports veterinary clinics in multiple countries across the globe.
 



 🔧
 **Modernization & Innovation** 
 – Help transition a
 **complex system** 
 to a
 **modern AWS-based** 
 architecture.
 



 🏡
 **Nice office, with hybrid possibilities** 
 – Fantastic office which we encourage members to work from. With flexible work setup.
 



 🤝
 **Global & Collaborative Team** 
 – Join a team of engineers and product specialists in Sweden and France.
 **Corporate language is English** 
 to facilitate global collaboration.
 



 If you're passionate about
 **data engineering, AI development, system architecture, and making a real impact** 
 , we’d love to hear from you!
 



 🔹
 **Apply now and help us in our mission to enhance veterinary care globally!**

title: Integration Specialist
description:

 We build high-performance, real-time, event-driven architectures that deliver trusted data seamlessly. Specializing in complex, critical integrations across finance, retail, telecom, medtech, and government sectors, we provide deep technical expertise. With headquarters in Stockholm and team members across Sweden, we aim to be the number one integration provider and hire with this goal in mind.
 



  





**About You** 




 You have a solid foundation in backend development with a keen interest in modern integration practices. You're passionate about leveraging innovative technologies such as event-driven architectures, real-time data streaming, and containerized deployments to deliver robust integration solutions.

 Kafka, Azure DevOps, Jenkins, Terraform, Bicep, Helm, GitHub Actions, Argo CD, Ansible, Prometheus, Grafana

**Application** 




 We are continuously hiring and any qualified candidates will be contacted within 2-3 days.

title: Produktägare – Kundportal, Stockholm/Eskilstuna
job_function: Project Management, Business Development, and General Business
description:
Är du en driven och engagerad person med passion för digital utveckling? Vill du vara med och forma framtidens kundupplevelser? Vi söker nu en produktägare till vår kundportal som kommer att spela en nyckelroll i att leda och utveckla vårt digitala kunderbjudande. Om du brinner för att skapa värde för slutanvändare och har erfarenhet av att arbeta i agila team, då är detta möjligheten för dig!
   

  

 Som produktägare för vår kundportal kommer du att inneha en central roll i att leda det dagliga och långsiktiga utvecklingsarbetet av kundportalen tillsammans med utvecklingsteam och verksamhet. Du stöttar utvecklingsteamet genom att självständigt, och tillsammans, med affärsägare driva igenom olika utvecklingsinitiativ mot landsorganisationerna. I rollen ansvarar du för utvecklingen av nya funktioner från idé till lansering, där du säkerställer att den följer uppsatta roadsmaps och skapar verkligt värde för Swecons kunder och verksamhet.
   

  

**Dina Huvudsakliga Arbetsuppgifter Inkluderar**
* Äga teamets backlog och prioritera för att skapa mesta möjliga värde för slutanvändarna.
* Sätta roadmap och affärsplan tillsammans med affärsägarna i respektive marknad.
* Analysera marknads- och kundbehoven för att utveckla nya värdeskapande funktioner i portalen.
* Ansvara för lansering av nya uppdateringar och funktioner i kundportalen.
* Följa upp satta KPI:er och budget för kundportalen.
* Driva andra digitala utvecklingsprojekt relaterade till kundportalen.


 Vi söker dig som är en driven, strukturerad, analytisk person och som är öppen för att tänka i nya banor samt bra på att anpassa din kommunikation utifrån olika målgrupper, behov och utmaningar.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:**
* Relevant eftergymnasial utbildning inom till exempel Projektledning, IT eller Digitalisering samt 2–3 års arbetslivserfarenhet från liknande roller som produktägare eller projektledare.
* Erfarenhet från att leda det dagliga arbetet i tvärfunktionella team i enlighet med agila ramverk som exempelvis SCRUM.
* Vana att arbeta i DevOps, JIRA eller motsvarande.
* Kompetens inom stakeholder management och change management.
* Behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift.
* Erfarenhet från att driva eller medverka i utvecklingsprojekt och produktutveckling inom digitaliseringsområdet


 Meriterande är bland annat goda kunskaper i Tyska, kunskap i systemteknik, erfarenhet av BackEnd/FrontEnd utveckling, användarupplevelse samt certifiering inom produktägande och/eller ledarskap.
   

  

 Du kommer att ingå och välkomnas av ett team bestående av tre engagerade och motiverade kollegor och rapportera till Manager Digital Solutions.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper och lämplighet. Tjänsten är placerad antingen i Stockholm eller Eskilstuna. Vid placering i Eskilstuna förväntas du vara i Stockholm ungefär en dag varannan vecka. Tjänsten medför en del resor både inom Sverige och utomlands.
   

  

 Kontaktpersoner
   

  

 Pontus Jacobson, Manager Digital Solutions, 010-556 00 17
   

  

 Monica Strömberg, facklig kontaktperson Unionen, 010-556 34 66
   

  

*Noterbart är att hanteringstiden under sommaren kan komma att bli något längre på grund av semesterperioder.*

title: Enterprise Solutions Architect
description:
**Description**
 Are you passionate about cloud technology and helping customers innovate?
   

  

 Join our AWS Solutions Architecture team in Stockholm and empower enterprises across industries to innovate at speed and scale with cloud technologies.
   

  

 As a Solutions Architect at AWS, you’ll build technical relationships with customers of all sizes and operate as their trusted advisor, ensuring they get the most out of the cloud at every stage of their journey.
   

  

 You’ll manage the overall technical relationship between AWS and our customers, making recommendations on security, cost, performance, reliability and operational efficiency to accelerate their challenging, mission-critical projects.
   

  

 Internally, you will be the voice of the customer, sharing their needs and wants to inform the roadmap of AWS features.
   

  

 In this role, your creativity will link technology to tangible solutions, with the opportunity to define cloud-native reference architectures for a variety of use cases.
   

  

 You will participate in the creation and sharing of best practices, technical content and new reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts) and evangelize and educate about AWS technology (e.g. through workshops, user groups, meetups, public speaking, online videos or conferences).
   

  

 This role is within the Europe North organization (Sweden) and you would be working with Enterprise customers.
   

  

 If you can educate AWS customers about the art of the possible, while challenging the impossible... come build the future with us!
   

  

 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector.
   

  

 A day in the life
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Represent your region vis-à-vis AWS product teams and influence our GenAI & AI/ML roadmap to best support your customers.
   

  

 Work with account teams, AWS specialists (solution architects, data scientists) and partners to deliver results for your customers.
   

  

**About The Team**
 The Specialists Organization, within Amazon Global Sales Organization (AGS), positions AWS as the leading platform for GenAI and AI/ML workloads. We enable customers to become data-driven organizations and scale their AI capabilities. Working backwards from customer needs, we execute go-to-market plans as specialist sales and with our solution architect teams. As an AGS team member, you'll guide customers throughout their AWS journey, from new service ideation to accelerating adoption of established solutions. We think big, deliver exceptional results, and collaborate across AWS as #OneTeam.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Background in any of the following: Cloud Architecture, Systems Design, Software Development, Infrastructure Architecture, Data Engineering or DevOps
* Technical Degree (Computer Science, Maths, Engineering or equivalent) and/or relevant tech experience.
* Fluent written and verbal communication skills in English
* A passion for technology and for learning


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience designing, building, refactoring or operating large scale and impactful IT systems - either on premises or in the cloud
* Working knowledge of cloud native architectures
* Knowledge of a modern programming language (Python, JavaScript, Go, .Net, Java, etc.) and/or scripting, Infrastructure as Code etc.
* In-depth working knowledge in a technology domain such as distributed internet-scale web or mobile applications, DevOps, Serverless, Big Data, Analytics, Machine Learning, enterprise workloads (SAP, VMware, Windows etc.), high-performance databases (SQL and/or NoSQL), complex networking implementations, highly secured workloads etc.
* Experience working in a customer-facing role or a role which involved public speaking
* AWS certification (e.g. AWS Solutions Architect Associate or Professional) or other industry certification
* Fluent written and verbal communication skills in Swedish


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
